The highest when compared to other high-ranking officials who are paid by the state budget. What is the current salary of the president of the Republic of Indonesia? The government has never released exact figures. However, looking at the regulations regarding the president's salary, the amount is very far from the Rp 500 million figure. according to Article 2 of Law Number 7 of 1978, the president's salary is 6 times the basic salary of the highest official in Indonesia (chairman of the DPR, MA, and BPK). Meanwhile, in PP No. 75/2000 it is stated that the three officials receive a salary of IDR 5,040,000 per month. Thus, the president's basic salary is Rp. 30,240,000 per month. Presidential Decree No. 68/2001 also states that the amount of allowance for the office of president is Rp. 32,500,000. So, the total money that the president receives every month is IDR 62,740,000 or IDR 752,880,000 per year. According to the palace's statement, that number has not changed since 2001. With this figure, the salary of the president of the Republic of Indonesia is relatively small when compared to the leaders of major countries in the world. Singapore Prime Minister (PM) Lee Hsien Loong's salary was the highest, at USD 2.2 million or equivalent to Rp. 30.3 billion per year. After Lee, there is Doris Leuthard, president of Switzerland, with a salary of USD 437,000 or Rp 6 billion per year. Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Trunbull followed with a salary of USD 403,700 or Rp 5.5 billion per year. President Jokowi's salary is only higher than China's President Xi Jinping of USD 20,500 or IDR 283 million per year. University of Indonesia (UI) public policy observer Lina Miftahul Jannah stated that it is very natural for the president to have a very large income index. Thus, the income received by the number one person in Indonesia is very high. "That makes sense," he said. He explained that as head of state as well as  head of government, the duties, responsibilities, and risks of the president are enormous. Therefore, according to him, it is not natural that the salaries of officials who are paid from the state budget are greater than the president's. He emphasized that it would be dangerous if there were other government officials whose salaries were higher than the president.
berita_id: Saat ini pemerintah sedang mempersiapkan rancangan Peraturan Pemerintah (RPP) tentang gaji, tunjangan, dan fasilitas untuk pegawai negeri sipil.Jika RPP sebenarnya diratifikasi, gaji Presiden Republik Indonesia akan meningkat secara drastis.Mencapai Rp 500 juta per bulan atau RP 6,6 miliar per tahun.Jumlah tersebut dinyatakan dalam bahan RPP.Dengan indeks gaji presiden sebesar 96.000 poin, gaji presiden mencapai Rp 553 juta.Yang tertinggi jika dibandingkan dengan pejabat tinggi lainnya yang dibayar dengan anggaran negara.Berapa gaji Presiden Republik Indonesia saat ini?Pemerintah tidak pernah merilis angka yang tepat.Namun, melihat peraturan tentang gaji presiden, jumlahnya sangat jauh dari angka Rp 500 juta.Menurut Pasal 2 Hukum Nomor 7 tahun 1978, gaji Presiden adalah 6 kali gaji dasar pejabat tertinggi di Indonesia (ketua DPR, MA, dan BPK).Sementara itu, dalam PP No. 75/2000 dinyatakan bahwa ketiga pejabat menerima gaji IDR 5.040.000 per bulan.Dengan demikian, gaji dasar presiden adalah RP.30.240.000 per bulan.Keputusan Presiden No. 68/2001 juga menyatakan bahwa jumlah tunjangan untuk Kantor Presiden adalah RP.32.500.000.Jadi, total uang yang diterima presiden setiap bulan adalah IDR 62.740.000 atau IDR 752.880.000 per tahun.Menurut pernyataan Istana, jumlah itu tidak berubah sejak tahun 2001. Dengan angka ini, gaji Presiden Republik Indonesia relatif kecil jika dibandingkan dengan para pemimpin negara -negara besar di dunia.Gaji Perdana Menteri Singapura (PM) Lee Hsien Loong adalah yang tertinggi, di USD 2,2 juta atau setara dengan RP.30,3 miliar per tahun.Setelah Lee, ada Doris Leuthard, presiden Swiss, dengan gaji USD 437.000 atau Rp 6 miliar per tahun.Perdana Menteri Australia Malcolm Trunbull diikuti dengan gaji USD 403.700 atau RP 5,5 miliar per tahun.Gaji Presiden Jokowi hanya lebih tinggi dari Presiden China Xi Jinping dari USD 20.500 atau IDR 283 juta per tahun.Pengamat Kebijakan Publik University of Indonesia (UI) Lina Miftahul Jannah menyatakan bahwa sangat wajar bagi presiden untuk memiliki indeks pendapatan yang sangat besar.Dengan demikian, pendapatan yang diterima oleh orang nomor satu di Indonesia sangat tinggi."Itu masuk akal," katanya.Dia menjelaskan bahwa sebagai kepala negara serta kepala pemerintahan, tugas, tanggung jawab, dan risiko presiden sangat besar.Oleh karena itu, menurutnya, tidak wajar bahwa gaji pejabat yang dibayar dari anggaran negara lebih besar dari presiden.Dia menekankan bahwa akan berbahaya jika ada pejabat pemerintah lain yang gaji yang gaji lebih tinggi daripada presiden.

berita: Public concerns regarding the circulation of pacifiers suspected of containing dangerous chemicals have finally been answered. After conducting laboratory tests, the National Narcotics Agency (BNN) of East Java Province ensured that the teat candy was safe for consumption. Laboratory tests were carried out by the East Java BNNP on samples of pacifiers that had been troubling the public because they were suspected of containing dangerous chemicals or drugs. The results of laboratory tests surmise show that pacifiers do not contain narcotics or psychotropic substances, so they are suitable for consumption. However, if consumed in the long term, this candy will have the potential to cause cancer. That's because pacifiers contain chemical dyes and preservatives. For complete information, including an explanation from the East Java BNNP, see the video above.
berita_id: Kekhawatiran publik mengenai sirkulasi dot yang diduga mengandung bahan kimia berbahaya akhirnya dijawab.Setelah melakukan tes laboratorium, Badan Narkotika Nasional (BNN) dari Provinsi Jawa Timur memastikan bahwa permen TEAT aman untuk dikonsumsi.Tes laboratorium dilakukan oleh Java BNNP Timur pada sampel dot yang telah mengganggu publik karena mereka diduga mengandung bahan kimia atau obat -obatan berbahaya.Hasil tes laboratorium menduga menunjukkan bahwa dot tidak mengandung narkotika atau zat psikotropika, sehingga mereka cocok untuk dikonsumsi.Namun, jika dikonsumsi dalam jangka panjang, permen ini akan memiliki potensi untuk menyebabkan kanker.Itu karena dot mengandung pewarna dan pengawet kimia.Untuk informasi lengkap, termasuk penjelasan dari Java BNNP Timur, lihat video di atas.

berita: In various local media, news spread widely that Mother Illiza (Mayor of Banda Aceh) forbade Pokemon Go. The reason is because it means 'I am Jewish'. This was obtained by the mother through various news related to the meaning of the word Pokemon which was shared with her through various online media. I came to know about this reason after Mother later apologized to the public regarding her statement that forbids Pokemon Go. "Sorry if anyone offended Pokemon GO fans. I didn't mean anything, I commented that because of the many news that was shared with me about the meaning of Pokemon," the mother requested. There is no point in exaggerating this matter. There is also no purpose to harass the Mother, let alone question the Mother's Indonesian spelling and grammar, which in my opinion there are still many mistakes here and there. I am quite appreciative of his apology. Because we rarely find leaders who voluntarily apologize if they are wrong. I remember very well reading an article about the meaning of the word Pokemon 3 months ago through an online media in Indonesia. This media quoted it from dailymirror. He said, in Iraq Pokemon cartoons were banned during the reign of Saddam Hussein. Furthermore, the media explained that the ban was revealed through an Iraqi state document confiscated by American troops in 2004. The document said that the ban was carried out because of its negative meaning in the Syriac language (Syrian language) used by that country. Still according to the document, Pokemon is said to be very similar to the same term in that language which if interpreted in Indonesian is 'I am Jewish'. Likewise with the characters Pikachu and Charmander. These two words respectively in Syriac mean 'Be a Jew' and 'God Is Weak'. That's why Saddam was "allergic" to the terms in this Pokemon cartoon that (still according to the document) he banned them to prevent Jewish influences from entering the nation's children and banning culture. I think this is where the initial news spread that Pokemon means "I'm Jewish". As a result, some people are against this term because they hate Jews (perhaps). Regardless of whether or not there is such a document or there is a “shrimp behind the dent” in the news by America, I try to find a common thread. I concluded then that there were some people who misunderstood the news. Either because I only heard from other people, just read the title, or misinterpreted it after reading it. Mistakes like that are commonplace because there is no ivory that is not cracked. However, it is very unfortunate because it can cause extraordinary commotion among the people due to the birth of a misleading "fatwa" without first crosschecking. If it is true that Saddam Husein banned Pokemon from showing in his country for reasons as quoted by the online media, we need to be careful to understand that he banned it because the word which is almost the same form is also in his language. It's just that coincidence has a negative meaning. So, in this case Saddam Husein compares the words produced by other countries (Japan as the country of Pokomen) with the language of his country. Attempts to interpret a word between one language and another because the form is the same, but the meaning is actually different in language review is commonplace and need not be a problem as long as it does not result in misunderstanding, let alone blind imitation. In fact, many of the world's language vocabularies have the same shape as other linguistic vocabularies, but have negative meanings, and this is not accidental. I remember exactly the largest car manufacturer in India, Tata Motors, changing the name of its newest car at that time, namely Zica. The reason, the name is similar to the name of a virus that is endemic in the United States. Likewise with the name of the Chevrolet Nova car made by General Motors which had to be replaced when it was sold in Spanish-speaking countries because it meant "not working". Likewise with the Mitsubishi Pajero. This car also does not sell well in Spanish-speaking countries because the Pajero in Spanish means 'lazy' or 'unreliable'. Even more ridiculous is the Mercedes Benz Vito. This car is guaranteed not to be sold in Sweden because "Vito" means 'female genitals'. So, because of the negative meaning of these words, many cars do not sell in the country of destination of the car manufacturer. All solely because of the negative meaning it carries. Perhaps there is a certain belief by the people who use the language if the car is purchased. Call it for example the Chevrolet Nova which means 'not working' or the Pajero 'lazy'. People who use this language may believe that if purchased, this car will not run or be tough in the field. However, in fact we do not see that. So, why did the car sell well in Indonesia, as well as in Aceh? Yes, of course because these words do not exist in our language. Now, after we know these names have negative meanings in Spanish, are we then reluctant to buy them or resell them to those who have already bought them? Of course not, not because these cars have proven to be tough in the field. Even if it is damaged or doesn't work, it's certainly not because of a negative meaning, but simply because of certain damage to the car. There is a similarity in the form of a word in a language with another language, but it has a negative meaning, of course, not only in the languages ​​of the world. We also have our language. Call it, for example, between the Acehnese language and the Gayo language. The Acehnese language has a utôh vocabulary which means 'builder'. However, when it comes to the Gayo language, words that are almost the same in form and pronunciation have negative meanings in that language. So, because of its negative meaning in the Gayo language, is it then forbidden to use the word utôh in the Acehnese language? Of course not not. The proof is that we still use it to this day and it doesn't need to be banned, it is said that it is again forbidden. Such cases do not only occur between languages, but also within a language. Call it the word ipôk (Acehnese language used by some people in the south-west region). In the Acehnese language in this area, ipôk means 'pocket', but will be laughed at by some Acehnese speakers in the eastern region because of its negative meaning in the Acehnese dialect of that area. Because of this, users of the Acehnese language in the south-west region certainly don't have to bother looking for other words or force themselves to use balum which is considered to have the same meaning as ipôk and does not seem negative. Likewise, the users of the Acehnese language in the eastern region. They certainly don't need to replace or use lumus to find another word for boh pik 'gambas' because of its negative meaning in the Acehnese language in the south-west region. The same case also occurs in Indonesian. We don't need to complain about finding a substitute for my word with another pronoun because the origin of the word is from sahaya which means 'slave'. Likewise, looking for a substitute for the word champion because of its negative initial meaning, namely the activity of fighting cocks. Of course it's pointless and pointless. Why did all that happen? The answer, of course, is that language has a close relationship with the culture of its speakers. The Acehnese language is very closely related to the culture of the Acehnese language user community itself. The same goes for the Spanish I mentioned above. This relationship, in my opinion, is one-way (only between the language and the user of that language). So, it can't be related to other people's cultures, which of course have different languages. Indonesian language associated with the Suriani language certainly does not "fit" because of its culture. Likewise, the word Pokemon used by Japan will never be compatible with the Suriani language, let alone with Indonesian. The Acehnese language associated with the Gayo language will also not be in sync, again because of the culture. It is unimaginable that quite a number of words must be replaced when two or more languages ​​are harmonized in meaning because of the same form and pronunciation. Even if it is forced, there will be a cultural clash that results in uproar in society. Therefore, be wise in language and understand the language. Remember, language can be a source of conflict if misused.

Jakarta, Information is a very useful thing for us, especially if it is about handling or preventing certain things. But unfortunately it is still used by a group of people to spread untrue news. After being rife with substances that can trigger brain hardening, there is another hoax being spread about first aid for people with stroke. This message continues to be spread over and over and there are still many who believe it. The message explains how the first action should be taken in stroke patients. If the patient falls like in the bathroom or bedroom, you are advised not to move him anywhere. Next you are recommended to take a needle and sterilize it and then insert it into your fingers. After that, spit out the victim's blood a drop or two. Still according to the message, if the victim's mouth is tilted, then pull the two earlobe until they are red and immediately pierce the bottom of the earlobe with a sterile needle until approximately 1-2 drops of blood comes out. It is believed to launch and help oxygen enter the body of the victim who experiences it. confirmed about the news on Monday (18/3/2013), dr Ahmad Yanuar, SpS dismissed the truth. So far there is no such research, it is not known whether the action is effective or not, the neurologist about from the University of Indonesia told detikHealth. This is also confirmed by Dr. Fritz Sumantri, SpS. What must be underlined is that medicine departs from research and trials. As for the way beyond that there has been no research. At least it's not safe yet. Until now medical science does not know such a method, so we also do not know its effectiveness, he stressed. the only action that must be done immediately is to be taken to the hospital and given reperfusion action at the fastest hour. About 3-6 hours after the incident, the patient must be immediately rushed to the hospital for medical treatment, added Dr. Ahmad. Well, if you get information about things like this, you should ask your doctor about the truth. Because if you are not careful this action can cause other diseases or cause the patient not to be helped.
berita_id: Jakarta, informasi adalah hal yang sangat berguna bagi kami, terutama jika itu tentang menangani atau mencegah hal -hal tertentu.Namun sayangnya itu masih digunakan oleh sekelompok orang untuk menyebarkan berita yang tidak benar.Setelah penuh dengan zat yang dapat memicu pengerasan otak, ada tipuan lain yang menyebar tentang pertolongan pertama untuk orang dengan stroke.Pesan ini terus tersebar berulang -ulang dan masih banyak yang mempercayainya.Pesan tersebut menjelaskan bagaimana tindakan pertama harus diambil pada pasien stroke.Jika pasien jatuh seperti di kamar mandi atau kamar tidur, Anda disarankan untuk tidak memindahkannya ke mana pun.Selanjutnya Anda disarankan untuk mengambil jarum dan mensterilkannya dan kemudian memasukkannya ke jari -jari Anda.Setelah itu, keluarkan satu atau dua darah korban.Masih menurut pesan itu, jika mulut korban dimiringkan, maka tarik kedua daun telinga sampai merah dan segera menembus bagian bawah daun telinga dengan jarum steril sampai sekitar 1-2 tetes darah keluar.Dipercayai untuk meluncurkan dan membantu oksigen memasuki tubuh korban yang mengalaminya.Dikonfirmasi tentang berita tersebut pada hari Senin (18/3/2013), Dr Ahmad Yanuar, SPS menolak kebenaran.Sejauh ini tidak ada penelitian seperti itu, tidak diketahui apakah tindakannya efektif atau tidak, ahli saraf tentang dari University of Indonesia mengatakan kepada DetikHealth.Ini juga dikonfirmasi oleh Dr. Fritz Sumantri, SPS.Yang harus digarisbawahi adalah bahwa obat berangkat dari penelitian dan uji coba.Adapun jauh melampaui itu belum ada penelitian.Setidaknya belum aman.Sampai sekarang ilmu kedokteran tidak tahu metode seperti itu, jadi kami juga tidak tahu keefektifannya, ia menekankan.Satu -satunya tindakan yang harus dilakukan segera adalah dibawa ke rumah sakit dan diberikan tindakan reperfusi pada jam tercepat.Sekitar 3-6 jam setelah insiden itu, pasien harus segera dilarikan ke rumah sakit untuk perawatan medis, tambah Dr. Ahmad.Nah, jika Anda mendapatkan informasi tentang hal -hal seperti ini, Anda harus bertanya kepada dokter Anda tentang kebenaran.Karena jika Anda tidak berhati -hati, tindakan ini dapat menyebabkan penyakit lain atau menyebabkan pasien tidak terbantu.

berita: When people face the fact that medical treatment, especially for serious illnesses, costs a lot, then alternative medicine is really an option. In addition to affordable costs, alternative medicine does not require medical actions which for some people are very scary, such as having to undergo surgery. Now there are many treatments that rely on eastern medicine, one of which is Drs H Ahmad Baraas, MSi on Jl Nuansa Timur Number 6, Nuansa Kori Housing, Ubung Kaja, Denpasar. The man who is also a journalist opens a practice for the treatment of various diseases by using the methods of pulling needles, acupuncture, cupping, traditional herbal medicine, electro-magnetic and bio-electric. Baraas studied alternative medicine a dozen years ago. At first he learned acupressure or massage with his hands, but his skills were only used to help his fellow journalists whose health was disturbed when they were doing the coverage together. Passionate about helping others and wanting to provide maximum therapeutic results, he then learned how to treat with cupping, treating diseases by stimulating nerve points. The man who was born in Jembrana, Bali was also dissatisfied with his therapeutic knowledge, so he pursued treatment using acupuncture, electro-magnetic and bio-electric methods. The electro magnetic technique treatment method is also known as the needle pull technique. Baraas studied acupuncture, needle pulling and bio-electricity from a therapist from Sumenep, Madura, Drs Firman Taufiq. It was from the caretaker of Padepokan Citra Sumekar that he also learned about Madurese medicines and concoctions. Baraas mixes some of the ingredients, combined with Balinese herbs and spices. In between his busy schedule as a journalist, Baraas always spends his time treating people who need help for therapy and he usually treats patients after carrying out his reporting duties as a journalist. The results of the therapy are recognized by a number of patients with maq pain, stomach ulcers, hemorrhoids, hernias, prostate, knee pain, high blood pressure, stroke, insomnia, sprains or wrong veins, chronic tingling, diabetes and others. For minor ailments such as fever, flu or headaches, usually with a spread of the herb on the head, the patient can be cured in a few moments. However, I am only an intermediary, God heals, he said. Talking about his experience being treated by Baraas, H Martiono (65) stated that he had previously been treated in a number of places, including receiving acupuncture therapy for a week at an alternative medicine clinic in Jakarta. But again, the trouble sleeping disorder can't go away. But when he tried to go to Baraas for treatment, he only had one therapy, now he can sleep for five hours a day. Previously I only slept an hour a day, from 11 pm to 12 pm. I've had that for years. Alhamdulillah, now I can sleep until dawn, said the owner of the electrical installation business. Another patient, Suarjaya (35), said he would take one of his family members to Baraas' residence, which is where the treatment is given. But he admitted that he had to call first, because he wanted to come during the day. The man from Karangasem Regency, Bali admitted that treatment at night was hit by a long distance, while the Karangasem-Denpasar transportation, which was about 90 kilometers away, was still not smooth. suarjaya narrates that he accidentally met Baraas. At that time he had a fever and caught influenza and Baraas who was nearby offered to help and it turned out that by rubbing a mixture on his head, his fever could be cured. That's why I will take my sick family for treatment to Haji Baraas, he said. The method of treatment given by Baraas is indeed different from other alternative treatments. He combines various methods, ranging from reflexology, cupping, gurah, needling, pulling the needle to bio-electric. This is realized because each method has weaknesses to treat patients with certain diseases. By using the combined method, the various weaknesses can be covered with each other. For example, for some diseases, it is not enough to only be treated with acupuncture, but also with cupping and needle pulling. masses Thus, the treatment can really reach the source of the disease completely, he said.
berita_id: Ketika orang menghadapi kenyataan bahwa perawatan medis, terutama untuk penyakit serius, harganya banyak, maka obat alternatif benar -benar menjadi pilihan.Selain biaya yang terjangkau, pengobatan alternatif tidak memerlukan tindakan medis yang bagi sebagian orang sangat menakutkan, seperti harus menjalani operasi.Sekarang ada banyak perawatan yang mengandalkan pengobatan timur, salah satunya adalah Drs H Ahmad Baraas, MSI di Jl Nuansa Timur Nomor 6, Nuansa Kori Housing, Ubung Kaja, Denpasar.Pria yang juga seorang jurnalis membuka praktik untuk pengobatan berbagai penyakit dengan menggunakan metode menarik jarum, akupunktur, cupping, obat herbal tradisional, elektro-magnetik dan bio-listrik.Baraas mempelajari kedokteran alternatif selusin tahun yang lalu.Pada awalnya ia belajar akupresur atau pijatan dengan tangannya, tetapi keterampilannya hanya digunakan untuk membantu sesama jurnalis yang kesehatannya terganggu ketika mereka melakukan liputan bersama.Bergairah membantu orang lain dan ingin memberikan hasil terapi maksimum, ia kemudian belajar bagaimana merawat dengan bekam, mengobati penyakit dengan merangsang titik saraf.Pria yang lahir di Jembrana, Bali juga tidak puas dengan pengetahuan terapeutiknya, jadi ia mengejar pengobatan menggunakan metode akupunktur, elektro-magnetik dan bio-listrik.Metode perawatan teknik magnetik elektro juga dikenal sebagai teknik tarik jarum.Baraas mempelajari akupunktur, penarik jarum dan bio-listrik dari terapis dari Sumenep, Madura, Drs Firman Taufiq.Dari penjaga Padepokan Citra Sumekar, ia juga belajar tentang obat -obatan dan ramuan Madure.Baraas mencampur beberapa bahan, dikombinasikan dengan ramuan dan rempah -rempah Bali.Di antara jadwalnya yang sibuk sebagai jurnalis, Baraas selalu menghabiskan waktunya merawat orang -orang yang membutuhkan bantuan untuk terapi dan dia biasanya merawat pasien setelah melaksanakan tugas pelaporannya sebagai jurnalis.Hasil terapi dikenali oleh sejumlah pasien dengan nyeri MAQ, bisul lambung, wasir, hernia, prostat, nyeri lutut, tekanan darah tinggi, stroke, insomnia, keseleo atau vena yang salah, kesemutan kronis, diabetes dan lainnya.Untuk penyakit ringan seperti demam, flu atau sakit kepala, biasanya dengan penyebaran ramuan di kepala, pasien dapat disembuhkan dalam beberapa saat.Namun, saya hanya perantara, Tuhan menyembuhkan, katanya.Berbicara tentang pengalamannya dirawat oleh Baraas, H Martiono (65) menyatakan bahwa ia sebelumnya telah dirawat di sejumlah tempat, termasuk menerima terapi akupunktur selama seminggu di klinik kedokteran alternatif di Jakarta.Tapi sekali lagi, gangguan tidur masalah tidak bisa hilang.Tetapi ketika dia mencoba pergi ke Baraas untuk perawatan, dia hanya menjalani satu terapi, sekarang dia bisa tidur selama lima jam sehari.Sebelumnya saya hanya tidur satu jam sehari, dari jam 11 malam sampai jam 12 siang.Saya sudah memilikinya selama bertahun -tahun.Alhamdulillah, sekarang saya bisa tidur sampai fajar, kata pemilik bisnis instalasi listrik.Pasien lain, Suarjaya (35), mengatakan dia akan membawa salah satu anggota keluarganya ke kediaman Baraas, yang merupakan tempat perawatan diberikan.Tetapi dia mengakui bahwa dia harus menelepon terlebih dahulu, karena dia ingin datang pada siang hari.Pria dari Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali mengakui bahwa perawatan di malam hari dilanda jarak jauh, sementara transportasi Karangasem-Denpasar, yang berjarak sekitar 90 kilometer, masih tidak halus.Suarjaya menceritakan bahwa dia secara tidak sengaja bertemu Baraas.Pada waktu itu dia mengalami demam dan menangkap influenza dan baraas yang di dekatnya ditawarkan untuk membantu dan ternyata dengan menggosok campuran di kepalanya, demamnya bisa disembuhkan.Itu sebabnya saya akan membawa keluarga saya yang sakit untuk perawatan ke Haji Baraas, katanya.Metode pengobatan yang diberikan oleh Baraas memang berbeda dari perawatan alternatif lainnya.Dia menggabungkan berbagai metode, mulai dari refleksi, bekam, gurah, tusuk jarum, menarik jarum ke bio-listrik.Ini direalisasikan karena setiap metode memiliki kelemahan untuk mengobati pasien dengan penyakit tertentu.Dengan menggunakan metode gabungan, berbagai kelemahan dapat ditutupi satu sama lain.Misalnya, untuk beberapa penyakit, tidak cukup hanya diobati dengan akupunktur, tetapi juga dengan bekam dan penarikan jarum.Misa dengan demikian, pengobatan ini benar -benar dapat mencapai sumber penyakit sepenuhnya, katanya.

berita: The rampant sales of pacifiers suspected of containing drug substances made the public uneasy, especially the circulation of pacifiers suspected of containing drug addictive substances began to spread and was found in remote rural areas, Malang Regency. One of the residents of Rt.30 / Rw.06 Krebet village, Bululawang District, Mujib Idris, admitted that he found the pacifiers sold in front of a Kindergarten (TK) school consumed by kindergarten-aged children in Bulupanyung hamlet, Krebet Village, Bululawang District. "I found out from one of the parents who at that time had bought their child, one candy had been opened and the other had not been opened," explained Mujib Idris. Due to the growing news that the candy pacifier was suspected of containing addictive ingredients, his party chose to secure the candy. Now the public is restless with the circulation of the pacifier candy which allegedly contains the drug. Moreover, the news in a number of candy media is dangerous. Therefore, his party asked the government authorities to calm the public by conducting raids. He explained that the candy pacifier was shaped like a bottle for a baby to drink which contained white powder. Therefore, his party asked the government to immediately provide clarity to the public, whether the candy is really dangerous or not for consumption. "If it is really dangerous, we are asked to immediately conduct a sweeping of the number of candy sellers in schools, at this time we as parents are quite nervous," he complained. Information that has been collected in the field, various reports are developing, the pacifier candy is still waiting for the results of the laboratory test in Surabaya to determine whether the ingredients for the pacifier are dangerous or not, because the candy is reportedly registered with BPOM with the code BPOM RI ML 22 440 900 3077. Separately, one of the parents of a resident of Jl Malik Dalam Kelurahan or Kedungkandang Sub-district, Malang city, Galuh Ayu also admitted that she was worried about the circulation of the candy which allegedly contained the addictive substance. He said that when he received the news that the pacifier was dangerous, his party forwarded the information to his relatives. "Supervision of children in consuming school snacks must be tightened. This has been circulating in the community through TV, Radio, Online and even Print, thank you. People must be more vigilant," he added. Meanwhile, the Head of Reskba Polres Malang AKP. Syamsul Hidayat when confirmed via his cell phone admitted that his party was still waiting for the results of laboratory tests from BPOM regarding the alleged presence of take drug additives in the children's candy. "We are still waiting for the results. If it is proven positive (drugs), of course action will be taken," said Syamsul
berita_id: Penjualan dot yang merajalela yang diduga mengandung zat obat membuat publik tidak nyaman, terutama sirkulasi dot yang diduga mengandung zat adiktif narkoba mulai menyebar dan ditemukan di daerah pedesaan terpencil, Kabupaten Malang.Salah satu penghuni Desa Rt.30 / RW.06 Krebet, Distrik Bululawang, Mujib Idris, mengakui bahwa ia menemukan dot yang dijual di depan sekolah TK) yang dikonsumsi oleh anak-anak berusia TK di Dusun Bulupanyung, desa Krebet, distrik Bululawang."Saya mengetahui dari salah satu orang tua yang pada waktu itu telah membeli anak mereka, satu permen telah dibuka dan yang lain belum dibuka," jelas Mujib Idris.Karena berita yang berkembang bahwa dot permen diduga mengandung bahan -bahan adiktif, partainya memilih untuk mengamankan permen.Sekarang publik gelisah dengan sirkulasi permen dot yang diduga mengandung obat.Selain itu, berita di sejumlah media permen berbahaya.Karena itu, partainya meminta otoritas pemerintah untuk menenangkan masyarakat dengan melakukan penggerebekan.Dia menjelaskan bahwa dot permen berbentuk seperti botol untuk minum bayi yang berisi bubuk putih.Oleh karena itu, partainya meminta pemerintah untuk segera memberikan kejelasan kepada publik, apakah permen itu benar -benar berbahaya atau tidak untuk dikonsumsi."Jika itu benar -benar berbahaya, kami diminta untuk segera melakukan menyapu jumlah penjual permen di sekolah, pada saat ini kami sebagai orang tua cukup gugup," keluhnya.Informasi yang telah dikumpulkan di lapangan, berbagai laporan sedang berkembang, permen dot masih menunggu hasil uji laboratorium di Surabaya untuk menentukan apakah bahan -bahan untuk dot itu berbahaya atau tidak, karena permen tersebut dilaporkan terdaftar dengan BPOM dengan Kode Bpom Ri Ml 22 440 900 3077.Sub-District Kedungk-District, Kota Malang, Gang Ayu juga mengakui bahwa dia khawatir tentang sirkulasi permen yang diduga mengandung zat adiktif.Dia mengatakan bahwa ketika dia menerima berita bahwa dot itu berbahaya, partainya meneruskan informasi itu kepada kerabatnya."Pengawasan anak -anak dalam mengonsumsi makanan ringan sekolah harus dikencangkan. Ini telah beredar di komunitas melalui TV, radio, online dan bahkan mencetak, terima kasih. Orang -orang pasti lebih waspada," tambahnya.Sementara itu, kepala Reskba Polres Malang AKP.Syamsul Hididesy ketika dikonfirmasi melalui ponselnya mengakui bahwa partainya masih menunggu hasil tes laboratorium dari BPOM mengenai dugaan keberadaan Take Drug Aditif dalam permen anak -anak."Kami masih menunggu hasilnya. Jika terbukti positif (obat -obatan), tentu saja tindakan akan diambil," kata Syamsul

berita: Jurnalmuslim.com - Pokemon cartoons were banned in Iraq by President Saddam Hussein. Of course, the prohibition is not just a ban without a reason. There are good reasons why Saddam Hussein was so adamant in boycotting these children's cartoons. The Japanese-made film also became a spectacle loved by children in Indonesia. One of the private television stations, MNC confiscate TV is the holder of the broadcasting rights. In a state document confiscated by US troops, during a coup in 2004, it was revealed that there were "uncommendable" actions or negative messages behind the film. The document states that President Saddam Hussein received information about the film from the state intelligence agency. According to information, the names used in the Pokemon movies contain an invitation that cannot be tolerated. Apparently, the word Pokemon itself means "I'm Jewish". The name Pokemon is taken from the Syriac language, or the Syriac language which in Indonesian means 'I am Jewish'. Not only Pokemon that has this surprising meaning, but also in other characters, such as Pikachu, the main character in the Pokemon movie. Pikachu, means 'Be a Jew'. Charmander character, which also means: 'God is Weak'. Of course, the meaning is very offensive to adherents of religion, especially Islam and Christianity. Because, in Islam, it is clearly called Allahu Akbar (God is Great). Dan in Christianity is called the Holy God. The reason for the ban, as stated in the document, was to prevent the entry of Jewish influences into the children and the nation's culture. Syriac is the language commonly spoken by Christian communities in the Middle East, especially Syrian Christians in eastern Turkey, northern Iraq, and northeastern Syria. (neutrality)
berita_id: Jurnalmuslim.com - Kartun Pokemon dilarang di Irak oleh Presiden Saddam Hussein.Tentu saja, larangan ini bukan hanya larangan tanpa alasan.Ada alasan bagus mengapa Saddam Hussein begitu bersikeras memboikot kartun anak -anak ini.Film buatan Jepang juga menjadi tontonan yang dicintai oleh anak-anak di Indonesia.Salah satu stasiun televisi pribadi, MNC menyita TV adalah pemegang hak penyiaran.Dalam sebuah dokumen negara yang disita oleh pasukan AS, selama kudeta pada tahun 2004, terungkap bahwa ada tindakan "tidak menyenangkan" atau pesan negatif di balik film tersebut.Dokumen tersebut menyatakan bahwa Presiden Saddam Hussein menerima informasi tentang film dari Badan Intelijen Negara.Menurut informasi, nama -nama yang digunakan dalam film Pokemon berisi undangan yang tidak dapat ditoleransi.Rupanya, kata pokemon itu sendiri berarti "aku orang Yahudi".Nama Pokemon diambil dari bahasa Syria, atau bahasa Syria yang dalam bahasa Indonesia berarti 'Saya Yahudi'.Tidak hanya Pokemon yang memiliki makna mengejutkan ini, tetapi juga dalam karakter lain, seperti Pikachu, karakter utama dalam film Pokemon.Pikachu, berarti 'menjadi orang Yahudi'.Karakter Charmander, yang juga berarti: 'Tuhan itu lemah'.Tentu saja, artinya sangat menyinggung penganut agama, terutama Islam dan Kekristenan.Karena, dalam Islam, itu jelas disebut Allahu Akbar (Tuhan itu hebat).Dan dalam Kekristenan disebut Dewa Suci.Alasan larangan tersebut, sebagaimana dinyatakan dalam dokumen, adalah untuk mencegah masuknya pengaruh Yahudi ke dalam anak -anak dan budaya bangsa.Syria adalah bahasa yang biasa digunakan oleh komunitas Kristen di Timur Tengah, terutama orang -orang Kristen Suriah di Turki Timur, Irak Utara, dan Suriah timur laut.(kenetralan)

berita: The news circulating about the plan to increase the salaries of the President and Vice President of the Republic of Indonesia is confirmed to be untrue. This certainty was revealed after the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati confirmed this in front of journalists at the Bogor Presidential Palace, West Java. "It be does not exist and has never been discussed," he said on Monday, March 12, 2018 While giving a statement regarding President Joko Widodo's meeting with the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) delegation, he received a question about it. "What the Menpan said (in social media) was a hoax, it was indeed like that. In today's social media there is a lot of information and documents that are made similar to those of the government and published," he said. and Deputy The President of the Republic of Indonesia In this issue, it is stated that the president will be proposed to receive a salary of up to Rp. 553422694 per month. The vice president is said to be proposed to receive a salary of Rp. 368948462 per month.
berita_id: Berita yang beredar tentang rencana untuk meningkatkan gaji presiden dan wakil presiden Republik Indonesia dikonfirmasi tidak benar.Kepastian ini terungkap setelah Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengkonfirmasi hal ini di depan jurnalis di Istana Presiden Bogor, Jawa Barat."Itu tidak ada dan tidak pernah dibahas," katanya pada hari Senin, 12 Maret 2018 sambil memberikan pernyataan tentang pertemuan Presiden Joko Widodo dengan delegasi Bank Investasi Investasi Asia (AIIB), ia menerima pertanyaan tentang hal itu."Apa yang dikatakan Menpan (di media sosial) adalah tipuan, memang seperti itu. Di media sosial saat ini ada banyak informasi dan dokumen yang dibuat mirip dengan pemerintah dan diterbitkan," katanya.dan Wakil Presiden Republik Indonesia dalam masalah ini, dinyatakan bahwa Presiden akan diusulkan untuk menerima gaji hingga RP.553422694 per bulan.Wakil presiden dikatakan diusulkan untuk menerima gaji RP.368948462 per bulan.

berita: Is it true that every bite of catfish meat can trigger 3000 cancer cells in our body? Catfish are freshwater fish, which usually live in critical places such as rice fields, dirty and muddy fish ponds and swamps. Many catfish live in places that lack oxygen. These fish are also known as carnivores, because they eat small shrimp and worms. Catfish are also known as tough fish species, because they are equipped with an additional respiratory apparatus in the form of a labyrinth, which allows catfish to survive in polluted and dirty water conditions. This way of living and growing in such a dirty place has led to accusations that catfish contain cancer cells. However, currently, the catfish circulating in the market are not catfish that live in the wild. Currently, there are many catfish farming in ponds, by providing good quality feed and controlling the cleanliness of the pond so that it is free from pollution. According to data from the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP), catfish production in 2013 reached 543,461 tons, an increase from 441,217 tons in 2012 and 337,577 tons in 2011. Meanwhile, catfish consumption according to the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) was 29.98 kg/capita/ year, up from 22.58 kg/capita/year in 2004. In Jakarta no less than 6,000 pecel catfish stalls have been registered with the Indonesian Street Vendors Association (APKLI). The popularity of catfish always increases every year. This is inseparable from the myriad benefits of this murmured fish meat. The nutritional content found in catfish is a cheap source of valuable protein. As we know protein is very necessary for the growth of the fetus in the womb. Even the nutrition contained in 2.5 kg of catfish is equivalent to the nutrition of 1 kg of beef. The high phosphorus in catfish meat adds to the benefits of the fish, especially for pregnant women and their fetuses. In addition to phosphorus, potassium and sodium in catfish are also useful as the best food source for the heart and blood vessels. By regularly consuming catfish, it helps the heart work in pregnant mudcat women so that the blood will be pumped properly. The allegation that there are cancer cells in catfish cannot be believed to be true, this is reinforced by the statement of cancer experts from the Indonesian Oncology Association. Currently there is no research that states that eating catfish can trigger cancer, said dr.Dradjat R Suardi, SpB (K) Onk, a cancer expert from the Indonesian Oncology Association.
berita_id: Benarkah setiap gigitan daging ikan lele dapat memicu 3000 sel kanker dalam tubuh kita?Ikan lele adalah ikan air tawar, yang biasanya tinggal di tempat -tempat kritis seperti sawah, kolam ikan yang kotor dan berlumpur dan rawa -rawa.Banyak ikan lele tinggal di tempat -tempat yang kekurangan oksigen.Ikan -ikan ini juga dikenal sebagai karnivora, karena mereka makan udang kecil dan cacing.Ikan lele juga dikenal sebagai spesies ikan yang tangguh, karena mereka dilengkapi dengan peralatan pernapasan tambahan dalam bentuk labirin, yang memungkinkan ikan lele untuk bertahan hidup dalam kondisi air yang tercemar dan kotor.Cara hidup dan tumbuh di tempat yang begitu kotor ini telah menyebabkan tuduhan bahwa ikan lele mengandung sel kanker.Namun, saat ini, ikan lele yang beredar di pasar bukanlah ikan lele yang hidup di alam liar.Saat ini, ada banyak pertanian ikan lele di kolam, dengan memberikan pakan berkualitas baik dan mengendalikan kebersihan kolam sehingga bebas dari polusi.Menurut data dari Kementerian Urusan Maritim dan Perikanan (KKP), produksi ikan lele pada tahun 2013 mencapai 543.461 ton, meningkat dari 441.217 ton pada 2012 dan 337.577 ton pada tahun 2011. Sementara itu, Capfish Konsumsi Menurut Badan Statistik Sentral (bps) adalah 29,98 KG/CAPIT, sesuai dengan statistik sentral (bps) 29,98 KG/tahun, CapiT dari Badan Statistik Sentral (bps) adalah 29,98 KG/CAPIT, menurut statistik sentral (bps) 29,98 KG/KG.2004. Di Jakarta tidak kurang dari 6.000 kios ikan lele Pecel telah terdaftar di Indonesian Street Vendors Association (APKLI).Popularitas ikan lele selalu meningkat setiap tahun.Ini tidak dapat dipisahkan dari berbagai manfaat daging ikan yang bergumam ini.Kandungan nutrisi yang ditemukan dalam ikan lele adalah sumber protein berharga yang murah.Seperti yang kita ketahui, protein sangat diperlukan untuk pertumbuhan janin di dalam rahim.Bahkan nutrisi yang terkandung dalam 2,5 kg ikan lele setara dengan nutrisi 1 kg daging sapi.Tingginya fosfor dalam daging ikan lele menambah manfaat ikan, terutama untuk wanita hamil dan janinnya.Selain fosfor, kalium dan natrium dalam lele juga berguna sebagai sumber makanan terbaik untuk pembuluh jantung dan darah.Dengan mengonsumsi ikan lele secara teratur, itu membantu jantung bekerja pada wanita mudcat hamil sehingga darah akan dipompa dengan benar.Tuduhan bahwa ada sel kanker dalam ikan lele tidak dapat diyakini benar, ini diperkuat oleh pernyataan para ahli kanker dari Asosiasi Onkologi Indonesia.Saat ini tidak ada penelitian yang menyatakan bahwa makan lele dapat memicu kanker, kata Dr.Dradjat R Suardi, SPB (K) Onk, seorang ahli kanker dari Asosiasi Onkologi Indonesia.

berita: The Consulate General of the Republic of Indonesia in Davao City, Philippines, clarified the issue has been burning Reog Ponorogo related to the expulsion of idols or spirits. The objection was conveyed through a press release on its website which was updated this afternoon, Saturday, October 31, 2015. The Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City admitted that they had destroyed the reog ponorogo on October 20, 2015. Reog ponorogo is an asset they have had since 1988. So what is the real reason they destroy cultural objects by burning them? "The destruction by burning had to be carried out because the Ponorogo reog was already in a damaged condition and was eaten by termites," wrote the Indonesian Consulate manoeuver General in Davao. The Consulate General affirmed that the burning was not at all an attempt by the Consulate General in Davao City to damage or eliminate Reog Ponorogo as a cultural asset. The destruction of these assets has been carried out carefully and with full respect for Reog Ponorogo as a cultural asset. "The Consulate General in Davao City also wants to emphasize that the burning has absolutely nothing to do with efforts to exorcise idols or spirits." The Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City is currently communicating with parties in Indonesia to seek a new replacement for Reog Ponorogo. Previously, the Indonesian Minister of Foreign Affairs, Retno LP Marsudi, said that the news of a Reog Ponorogo being deliberately burned at the office of the Consulate General of the Republic of Indonesia (KJRI) in Davao, Philippines, was not entirely true. "Reog and gamelan decorations in the form of dragon heads were burned because they were damaged and infested with termites," said Retno via text message.
berita_id: Konsulat Jenderal Republik Indonesia di Kota Davao, Filipina, mengklarifikasi masalah ini telah membakar Reog Ponorogo terkait dengan pengusiran berhala atau roh.Keberatan itu disampaikan melalui siaran pers di situs webnya yang diperbarui sore ini, Sabtu, 31 Oktober 2015. Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Kota Davao mengakui bahwa mereka telah menghancurkan Ponorogo yang dirancang ulang pada 20 Oktober 2015. Reog Ponorogo adalah aset yang mereka miliki sejak tahun 1988."Penghancuran oleh pembakaran harus dilakukan karena Ponorogo Reog sudah dalam kondisi rusak dan dimakan oleh rayap," tulis jenderal manouver konsulat Indonesia di Davao.Konsulat Jenderal menegaskan bahwa pembakaran sama sekali tidak merupakan upaya oleh Konsulat Jenderal di Kota Davao untuk merusak atau menghilangkan Reog Ponorogo sebagai aset budaya.Penghancuran aset -aset ini telah dilakukan dengan hati -hati dan dengan penuh rasa hormat terhadap Reog Ponorogo sebagai aset budaya."Konsulat jenderal di Kota Davao juga ingin menekankan bahwa pembakaran sama sekali tidak ada hubungannya dengan upaya untuk mengusir idola atau roh."Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Kota Davao saat ini berkomunikasi dengan pihak -pihak di Indonesia untuk mencari pengganti baru untuk Reog Ponorogo.Sebelumnya, Menteri Luar Negeri Indonesia, Retno LP Marsudi, mengatakan bahwa berita tentang Ponorogo yang dirancang ulang dengan sengaja dibakar di kantor Jenderal Konsulat Republik Indonesia (KJRI) di Davao, Filipina, tidak sepenuhnya benar."Dekorasi reog dan gamelan dalam bentuk kepala naga dibakar karena rusak dan terinfeksi rayap," kata Retno melalui pesan teks.

berita: The dot-shaped candy product has obtained a production permit from the Food and Drug Supervisory Agency (BPOM). "Yes, it's true (it already has a permit)," said Head of the BPOM Food and Drug Investigation Center Hendri Siswadi, when contacted in Jakarta, Thursday, March 9 2017. The candy in the form of a pacifier suspected of containing drugs was found in Surabaya, East Java. BPOM Surabaya is examining the content of candy which is suspected confect to contain drugs. However, temporary results, said Hendri, the content of hazardous materials has not been found. "Until today, BPOM Surabaya has tested using 16 parameters with negative results." The discovery of the candy allegedly containing drugs stems from the routine operation of the Civil Service Police Unit when raiding students who were truant during school hours in Surabaya. One of them is in an Internet cafe that is usually used as a hangout place for students when playing truant. During the operation, the team found an elementary school student who felt dizzy after consuming candy. The head of the Civil Service Police Unit, Irvan Widianto, said that there were several forms of drug candy in the form of baby pacifiers with the brand name Hard Candy and jelly sticks. The police are also examining the candy findings. Yesterday, the Head of the Public Information Division of the National Police Public Relations Division, Senior Commissioner Martinus Sitompul, said that he was waiting for the forensic laboratory test of the Surabaya National Narcotics Agency.
berita_id: Produk permen berbentuk DOT telah memperoleh izin produksi dari Badan Pengawas Makanan dan Obat (BPOM)."Ya, itu benar (sudah memiliki izin)," kata kepala pusat investigasi makanan dan obat BPOM Hendri Siswadi, ketika dihubungi di Jakarta, Kamis, 9 Maret 2017. Permen dalam bentuk dot yang diduga mengandung obat -obatan ditemukan di Surabaya, Java Timur.BPOM Surabaya sedang memeriksa kandungan permen yang diduga mengutuk mengandung obat -obatan.Namun, hasil sementara, kata Hendri, kandungan bahan berbahaya belum ditemukan."Sampai hari ini, BPOM Surabaya telah menguji menggunakan 16 parameter dengan hasil negatif."Penemuan permen yang diduga mengandung obat -obatan berasal dari operasi rutin unit polisi layanan sipil ketika menggerebek siswa yang bolos selama jam sekolah di Surabaya.Salah satunya berada di kafe internet yang biasanya digunakan sebagai tempat nongkrong bagi siswa saat bermain bolos.Selama operasi, tim menemukan seorang siswa sekolah dasar yang merasa pusing setelah mengonsumsi permen.Kepala Unit Polisi Dinas Sipil, Irvan Widianto, mengatakan bahwa ada beberapa bentuk permen narkoba dalam bentuk dot bayi dengan nama merek permen keras dan tongkat jelly.Polisi juga memeriksa temuan permen.Kemarin, kepala Divisi Informasi Publik Divisi Hubungan Masyarakat Kepolisian Nasional, Komisaris Senior Martinus Sitompul, mengatakan bahwa ia sedang menunggu uji laboratorium forensik dari Badan Narkotika Nasional Surabaya.

berita: Wakoka.Co.Id – The demonstration was held today in Ponorogo square, Tuesday (10/11/2015), by several elements of the Ponorogo community consisting of Reyog Artists, Reyog Community, Reyog Pandemen and Ponorogo Citizens Association. This demonstration was carried out in connection with the reyog burning case at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines some time ago. In the demonstration, apart from giving speeches, the demonstrators also brought along several Reyog groups to enliven the action. As previously reported, the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao on October 20, 2015 burned the Ponorogo reyog art equipment stored in the Indonesian Consulate General's building. Although the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao issued a statement that the destruction of the Ponorogo reog by burning was carried out because its condition had been damaged and eaten by termites. However, the photos that circulated virally sealed and have even been distributed by local online media Bitung News, show that there was a certain ritual before the burning. One of the photos also shows that before being burned, the Ponorogo reog was stored in a glass cabinet and appeared to be in good condition. Apart from the reog, in another photo, it appears that the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao removed the dragon ornaments on the gamelan set and then also burned it. Representatives of the demonstrators were then met by PJ Regent of Ponorogo, and Chairman of the Ponorogo Regency DPRD on the 2nd floor of the Ponorogo DPRD building to convey their aspirations. Several representatives of the demonstrators then delivered a statement of attitude that strongly condemned the burning of reyog art instruments at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao. The demonstrators also demanded the removal of the individuals involved in the incident and demanded the government through the tourism office and the Ponorogo DPRD to thoroughly investigate the case. Responding to this, PJ Regent of Ponorogo, Ir. Maskur, MM said that the Regency Government had coordinated with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Kemlu). The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will replace the Reyog device that has been burned and is currently investigating the case through the Special Team. Previously, the Jabodetabek Reog Community had also sent an official letter to the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines, asking for clarification on information on the burning of reyog art instruments by Indonesian Consulate General officials.
berita_id: Wakoka.co.id - Demonstrasi diadakan hari ini di Ponorogo Square, Selasa (10/11/2015), oleh beberapa elemen komunitas Ponorogo yang terdiri dari seniman Reyog, komunitas Reyog, Reyog Pandemen dan Ponorogo Citizens Association.Demonstrasi ini dilakukan sehubungan dengan kasus Reyog Burning di Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao, Filipina beberapa waktu lalu.Dalam demonstrasi, selain memberikan pidato, para demonstran juga membawa beberapa kelompok Reyog untuk menghidupkan tindakan tersebut.Seperti yang dilaporkan sebelumnya, Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao pada 20 Oktober 2015 membakar peralatan seni Ponorogo Reyog yang disimpan di gedung Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia.Meskipun Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao mengeluarkan pernyataan bahwa penghancuran Ponorogo Reog dengan pembakaran dilakukan karena kondisinya telah rusak dan dimakan oleh rayap.Namun, foto -foto yang beredar disegel secara virus dan bahkan telah didistribusikan oleh media online Bitung News, menunjukkan bahwa ada ritual tertentu sebelum pembakaran.Salah satu foto juga menunjukkan bahwa sebelum dibakar, Ponorogo Reog disimpan dalam lemari kaca dan tampak dalam kondisi baik.Terlepas dari reog, di foto lain, tampaknya konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao menghapus ornamen naga pada set gamelan dan kemudian juga membakarnya.Perwakilan dari para demonstran kemudian dipenuhi oleh PJ Bupati Ponorogo, dan ketua DPRD Kabupaten Ponorogo di lantai 2 gedung Ponorogo DPRD untuk menyampaikan aspirasi mereka.Beberapa perwakilan dari para demonstran kemudian menyampaikan pernyataan sikap yang sangat mengutuk pembakaran instrumen seni Reyog di Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao.Para demonstran juga menuntut penghapusan orang -orang yang terlibat dalam insiden tersebut dan menuntut pemerintah melalui kantor pariwisata dan Ponorogo DPRD untuk menyelidiki kasus tersebut secara menyeluruh.Menanggapi ini, PJ Bupati Ponorogo, Ir.Maskur, MM mengatakan bahwa pemerintah Kabupaten telah berkoordinasi dengan Kementerian Luar Negeri (Kemlu).Kementerian Luar Negeri akan menggantikan perangkat Reyog yang telah dibakar dan saat ini sedang menyelidiki kasus ini melalui tim khusus.Sebelumnya, komunitas Reog Jabodetabek juga telah mengirim surat resmi kepada Jenderal Konsulat Indonesia di Davao, Filipina, meminta klarifikasi tentang informasi tentang pembakaran instrumen seni Reyog oleh pejabat umum konsulat Indonesia.

berita: Regarding the finding of candy snacks containing drugs, a number of people are worried, such as the Pekanbaru legislature. The Council asked the Police, Disperindag, BPOM and other related agencies enounce to act immediately and go to the field to ensure that the snacks for children suspected of containing drugs were not circulating in Pekanbaru City. "This is what worries us and the public, so it must be anticipated as soon as possible, so that it does not enter our area. For this reason, the police have been able to move down to the field to ensure that pacifiers suspected of containing drugs are not circulating in Pekanbaru, trace every trader and producer, " said Member of Commission II DPRD Pekanbaru City, Roem Diani Dewi, Friday (10/3). This PKS politician said that if the candy case which was indicated to contain drugs was true, then the police were asked to be firm and enforce the existing rules. "Don't let the goods have been circulated before taking action, because in some stalls it seems that they are already circulating, and we will see for ourselves," said Roem. In addition, said Roem, if it is proven that it is true and positive for containing drugs, law enforcement authorities are asked to be firm and give appropriate punishment to the food distributor or supplier. "It is the perpetrators of this crime who need to be dealt with. It is clear that this is damaging the nation's generation by incorporating harmful substances into snacks, especially for children," said Roem. Furthermore, Roem also hopes that, as a form of anticipation, the government, be it BPOM, Diskes, and schools need to work together to disseminate information to students about the dangers of drugs. "We hope that students are given an understanding of the dangers of this drug, especially if it is packaged in an attractive form like the alleged pacifier containing drugs, it is very difficult to be recognized by the public especially children. I think the school also plays a role and should not allow traffickers roaming outside schools whose health and safety are not guaranteed," explained Roem. The finding of pacifiers suspected of containing drugs is reportedly being traded in a number of elementary schools and kindergartens (TK) in the city of Surabaya, even to confirm the case, the Surabaya East Java government and other related parties such as the BPOM are reportedly conducting an investigation.
berita_id: Mengenai temuan camilan permen yang mengandung obat -obatan, sejumlah orang khawatir, seperti legislatif Pekanbaru.Dewan meminta polisi, Disperindag, BPOM, dan lembaga terkait lainnya untuk bertindak segera dan pergi ke lapangan untuk memastikan bahwa makanan ringan untuk anak -anak yang diduga mengandung obat -obatan tidak beredar di Kota Pekanbaru."Inilah yang membuat kami khawatir dan publik, jadi itu harus diantisipasi sesegera mungkin, sehingga tidak memasuki daerah kami. Untuk alasan ini, polisi telah dapat pindah ke lapangan untuk memastikan bahwa dot yang dicurigai mengandung obat -obatan tidak beredar di PEKANBARU, ROUS setiap pedagang dan produser," kata anggota Komisi II PEKAN.Politisi PKS ini mengatakan bahwa jika kasus permen yang diindikasikan mengandung narkoba itu benar, maka polisi diminta untuk menjadi tegas dan menegakkan aturan yang ada."Jangan biarkan barang telah diedarkan sebelum mengambil tindakan, karena di beberapa kios tampaknya mereka sudah beredar, dan kita akan melihat sendiri," kata Roem.Selain itu, kata Roem, jika terbukti bahwa itu benar dan positif untuk mengandung obat -obatan, otoritas penegak hukum diminta untuk tegas dan memberikan hukuman yang tepat kepada distributor makanan atau pemasok."Ini adalah pelaku kejahatan ini yang perlu ditangani. Jelas bahwa ini merusak generasi bangsa dengan memasukkan zat berbahaya ke dalam makanan ringan, terutama untuk anak -anak," kata Roem.Selain itu, Roem juga berharap bahwa, sebagai bentuk antisipasi, pemerintah, baik itu bpom, disk, dan sekolah perlu bekerja sama untuk menyebarkan informasi kepada siswa tentang bahaya narkoba."Kami berharap bahwa siswa diberi pemahaman tentang bahaya obat ini, terutama jika dikemas dalam bentuk yang menarik seperti dugaan dot yang mengandung obat -obatan, sangat sulit untuk diakui oleh publik terutama anak -anak. Saya pikir sekolah juga memainkan peran dan seharusnya tidak mengizinkan pedagang berkeliaran di luar sekolah yang kesehatan dan keselamatannya tidak dijamin," jelas Roem.Temuan dot yang diduga mengandung obat -obatan dilaporkan diperdagangkan di sejumlah sekolah dasar dan taman kanak -kanak (TK) di kota Surabaya, bahkan untuk mengkonfirmasi kasus tersebut, pemerintah Jawa East Surabaya dan partai -partai terkait lainnya seperti BPOM dilaporkan melakukan penyelidikan.

berita: Surabaya residents can breathe a sigh of relief after the confect Food and Drug Supervisory Agency (BBPOM) stated that the dot-shaped candy which was suspected to contain drugs turned out to be negative. The Head of the Consumer Information Service Section of BBPOM Surabaya, Lindawati said that based on the results of the lab test on the sample sent by the Surabaya Health Office in the form of a candy pacifier conducted by his party, it was found that the result was negative for the drug substance. "Our laboratory test results on samples sent by the Surabaya Health Office were only for candy in the form of a dot, and the results were negative," said Lindawati during a hearing with Commission D of the Surabaya City DPRD together with the Health Office, BNNK Surabaya, Satpol PP and the Education Office, Thursday (09/09). /03/2017)). Furthermore, Lindawati also explained that based on data from her party, the candy had a distribution permit from BBPOM and was legal. "We have announced the results on our website www.pom.go.id, people can see the information there," he explained. Even so, his party appealed to the public to be smart consumers by checking the food to be consumed. "We have supervised the product and supervised the way of production and advertising and labeling. Then the people themselves must be smart as consumers," he added. Meanwhile, the Surabaya City Satpol PP claimed to have secured around 1496 candies of various types which were obtained during the three-day operation in various sub-districts in Surabaya. "Based on the results of the three-day operation, we got around 1496 candies which we confiscated in various schools, both in elementary schools (SD) and kindergartens (TK) in various areas in Surabaya," said the Head of Supervision of the Surabaya Satpol PP, Saiful Ikhsan. Saiful also said that if the lab test results were negative, his party was also ready to return the candy that had been secured by the Satpol PP. Based on the latest data from the Wonokromo sub-district report, agents from the candy have also been found. "If the result is negative, we are ready to return the candy that we have taken because the owner has been recorded," he added.@wan
berita_id: Warga Surabaya dapat menghela nafas lega setelah Badan Pengawas Makanan dan Obat-obatan yang payah (BBPOM) menyatakan bahwa permen berbentuk dot yang diduga mengandung obat ternyata negatif.Kepala bagian Layanan Informasi Konsumen BBPOM Surabaya, Lindawati mengatakan bahwa berdasarkan hasil tes lab pada sampel yang dikirim oleh Kantor Kesehatan Surabaya dalam bentuk dot permen yang dilakukan oleh partainya, ditemukan bahwa hasilnya negatif untuk zat obat."Hasil tes laboratorium kami pada sampel yang dikirim oleh Kantor Kesehatan Surabaya hanya untuk permen dalam bentuk titik, dan hasilnya negatif," kata Lindawati dalam sidang dengan komisi D dari Kota Surabaya DPRD bersama dengan Kantor Kesehatan, BNNK Surabaya, Satpol PP dan Kantor Pendidikan, Kamis (09/09)./03/2017)).Selain itu, Lindawati juga menjelaskan bahwa berdasarkan data dari partainya, permen memiliki izin distribusi dari BBPOM dan legal."Kami telah mengumumkan hasil di situs web kami www.pom.go.id, orang dapat melihat informasi di sana," jelasnya.Meski begitu, partainya mengajukan banding kepada publik untuk menjadi konsumen yang cerdas dengan memeriksa makanan yang akan dikonsumsi."Kami telah mengawasi produk dan mengawasi cara produksi dan iklan dan pelabelan. Kemudian orang -orang itu sendiri harus pintar sebagai konsumen," tambahnya.Sementara itu, Surabaya City Satpol PP mengklaim telah mendapatkan sekitar 1496 permen dari berbagai jenis yang diperoleh selama operasi tiga hari di berbagai sub-distrik di Surabaya."Berdasarkan hasil operasi tiga hari, kami mendapatkan sekitar 1496 permen yang kami sita di berbagai sekolah, baik di sekolah dasar (SD) dan taman kanak-kanak (TK) di berbagai daerah di Surabaya," kata kepala pengawasan Surabaya Satpol PP, Saiful Ikhsan.Saiful juga mengatakan bahwa jika hasil tes lab negatif, partainya juga siap untuk mengembalikan permen yang telah diamankan oleh Satpol PP.Berdasarkan data terbaru dari laporan sub-distrik Wonokromo, agen-agen dari permen juga telah ditemukan."Jika hasilnya negatif, kami siap untuk mengembalikan permen yang telah kami ambil karena pemilik telah direkam," tambahnya.@Wan

berita: Amazing, Netizens are busy making hashtags to uninstall the Traveloka application on social media. This was apparently triggered by pianist Ananda Sukarlan's walk out when the Governor of DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan gave a speech at the Kanisius Colosse Awards at Hall D JIExpo Kemayoran, Saturday (11/11/2017) Traveloka also responded to the news about the call to boycott its services. This hotel and travel ticket booking application also provides clarification regarding the events at the Canisius College event. According to news circulating on the timeline, one of the founders and CTO of Traveloka, Derianto Kusuma, greeted and congratulated Ananda after the walk out and Anies' speech, which was considered as support for Ananda's action. I don't know who started it, this information then provoked some netizens to boycott Traveloka. The hashtag #BoikotTraveloka has become one of Indonesia's trending Twitter topics. During his speech, Ananda Sukarlan said what was allegedly satirizing Anies Baswedan. In his speech, Ananda criticized the committee for inviting someone who got a position in a way that was not in accordance with Kanisius' values. "You have invited someone who got his position in ways that are different from the values ​​and gens integrity that we have been taught at Canisius. Although you may have to invite him because of his position, but next time we have to see what kind of person he is. Here I am. not talking about politics, this is a matter of conscience and human values," he said. Meanwhile, Traveloka PR Manager Busyra Oryza confirmed that Traveloka founder and CTO Derianto Kusuma was one of the award recipients at the event. But he was unable to attend. "Traveloka is proud that one of our founders, Derianto Kusuma, received an award from Kanisius alumni. However, he was unable to attend because he was on an official trip that had been planned a few months earlier. Ananda), he was not there," he said. "We state that Traveloka is a technology-based company founded by the sons and daughters of the Indonesian nation that puts forward the values ​​of mutual respect, tolerance and innovation. These values ​​are always applied to employees and external stakeholders," he continued. Regarding the circulation of mention of Derianto's name providing support to Ananda and raising an invitation to boycott Traveloka, according to Busyro, Traveloka is still investigating. "We have just seen a lot of people about this, we are also still investigating. What I can say is that he was unable to attend and we have not taken any position," he said. Derianto and Ananda are two of the five outstanding Kanisius College alumni who received awards at this event. Besides the two, there were Father Magnis Suseno (a Jesuit figure), Irwan Ismaun Soenggono (a Scout leader) and Dr. Boenjamin Setiawan (founder of Kalbe Farma).
berita_id: Luar biasa, netizen sibuk membuat tagar untuk menghapus aplikasi Traveloka di media sosial.Ini tampaknya dipicu oleh pianis Ananda Sukarlan keluar ketika gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan memberikan pidato di Kanisius Colosse Awards di Hall D Jiexpo Kemayoran, Sabtu (11/11/2017) Traveloka juga menanggapi news tentang panggilan untuk memboikotnya.Aplikasi pemesanan hotel dan tiket perjalanan ini juga memberikan klarifikasi mengenai acara di acara Canisius College.Menurut berita yang beredar di timeline, salah satu pendiri dan CTO Traveloka, DeRianto Kusuma, menyambut dan memberi selamat kepada Ananda setelah pidato berjalan dan anies, yang dianggap sebagai dukungan untuk tindakan Ananda.Saya tidak tahu siapa yang memulainya, informasi ini kemudian memprovokasi beberapa netizen untuk memboikot Traveloka.Tagar #Boikottraveloka telah menjadi salah satu topik Twitter yang sedang tren di Indonesia.Selama pidatonya, Ananda Sukarlan mengatakan apa yang diduga menyindir Anies Baswedan.Dalam pidatonya, Ananda mengkritik komite karena mengundang seseorang yang mendapat posisi dengan cara yang tidak sesuai dengan nilai -nilai Kanisius."Anda telah mengundang seseorang yang mendapatkan posisinya dengan cara yang berbeda dari nilai -nilai dan integritas gens yang telah kami ajarkan di Canisius. Meskipun Anda mungkin harus mengundangnya karena posisinya, tetapi lain kali kita harus melihat orang seperti apa dia. Di sini saya. Tidak berbicara tentang politik, ini adalah masalah hati nurani dan nilai -nilai manusia," katanya.Sementara itu, manajer PR Traveloka Busyra Oryza mengkonfirmasi bahwa pendiri Traveloka dan CTO DeRianto Kusuma adalah salah satu penerima penghargaan di acara tersebut.Tapi dia tidak bisa hadir."Traveloka bangga bahwa salah satu pendiri kami, DeRianto Kusuma, menerima penghargaan dari alumni Kanisius. Namun, ia tidak dapat hadir karena ia sedang dalam perjalanan resmi yang telah direncanakan beberapa bulan sebelumnya. Ananda), ia tidak ada di sana," katanya."Kami menyatakan bahwa Traveloka adalah perusahaan berbasis teknologi yang didirikan oleh putra dan putri negara Indonesia yang mengedepankan nilai-nilai saling menghormati, toleransi dan inovasi. Nilai-nilai ini selalu diterapkan pada karyawan dan pemangku kepentingan eksternal," lanjutnya.Mengenai sirkulasi menyebutkan nama Deraianto memberikan dukungan kepada Ananda dan mengajukan undangan untuk memboikot Traveloka, menurut Busyro, Traveloka masih menyelidiki."Kami baru saja melihat banyak orang tentang ini, kami juga masih menyelidiki. Apa yang dapat saya katakan adalah bahwa ia tidak dapat hadir dan kami belum mengambil posisi apa pun," katanya.DeRianto dan Ananda adalah dua dari lima alumni Kanisius College yang luar biasa yang menerima penghargaan di acara ini.Selain keduanya, ada ayah Magnis Suseno (sosok Jesuit), Irwan Ismaun Soenggono (seorang pemimpin pengintai) dan Dr. Boenjamin Setiawan (pendiri Kalbe Farha).

berita: When people face the fact that medical treatment, especially for serious illnesses, costs a lot, then alternative medicine is really an option. In addition to affordable costs, alternative medicine does not require medical actions which for some people are very scary, such as having to undergo surgery. Now there are many treatments that rely on eastern medicine, one of which is Drs H Ahmad Baraas, MSi on Jl Nuansa Timur Number 6, Nuansa Kori Housing, Ubung Kaja, Denpasar. The man who is also a journalist opens a practice for the treatment of various diseases by using the methods of pulling needles, acupuncture, cupping, traditional herbal medicine, electro-magnetic and bio-electric. Baraas studied alternative medicine a dozen years ago. At first he learned acupressure or massage with his hands, but his skills were only used to help his fellow journalists whose health was disturbed when they were doing the coverage together. Passionate about helping others and wanting to provide maximum therapeutic results, he then learned how to treat with cupping, treating diseases by stimulating nerve points. The man who was born in Jembrana, Bali was also dissatisfied with his therapeutic knowledge, so he pursued treatment using acupuncture, electro-magnetic and bio-electric methods. The electro magnetic technique treatment method is also known as the needle pull technique. Baraas studied acupuncture, needle pulling and bio-electricity from a therapist from Sumenep, Madura, Drs Firman Taufiq. It was from the caretaker of Padepokan Citra Sumekar that he also learned about Madurese medicines and concoctions. Baraas mixes some of the ingredients, combined with Balinese herbs and spices. In between his busy schedule as a journalist, Baraas always spends his time treating people who need help for therapy and he usually treats patients after carrying out his reporting duties as a journalist. The results of the therapy are recognized by a number of patients with maq pain, stomach ulcers, hemorrhoids, hernias, prostate, knee pain, high blood pressure, stroke, insomnia, sprains or wrong veins, chronic tingling, diabetes and others. For minor ailments such as fever, flu or headaches, usually with a spread of the herb on the head, the patient can be cured in a few moments. However, I am only an intermediary, God heals, he said. Talking about his experience being treated by Baraas, H Martiono (65) stated that he had previously been treated in a number of places, including receiving acupuncture therapy for a week at an alternative medicine clinic in Jakarta. But again, the trouble sleeping disorder can't go away. But when he tried to go to Baraas for treatment, he only had one therapy, now he can sleep for five hours a day. Previously I only slept an hour a day, from 11 pm to 12 pm. I've had that for years. Alhamdulillah, now I can sleep until dawn, said the owner of the electrical installation business. Another patient, Suarjaya (35), said he would take one of his family members to Baraas' residence, which is where the treatment is given. But he admitted that he had to call first, because he wanted to come during the day. The man from Karangasem Regency, Bali admitted that treatment at night was hit by a long distance, while the Karangasem-Denpasar transportation, which was about 90 kilometers away, was still not smooth. suarjaya narrates that he accidentally met Baraas. At that time he had a fever and caught influenza and Baraas who was nearby offered to help and it turned out that by rubbing a mixture on his head, his fever could be cured. That's why I will take my sick family for treatment to Haji Baraas, he said. The method of treatment given by Baraas is indeed different from other alternative treatments. He combines various methods, ranging from reflexology, cupping, gurah, needling, pulling the needle to bio-electric. This is realized because each method has weaknesses to treat patients with certain diseases. By using the combined method, the various weaknesses can be covered with each other. For example, for some diseases, it is not enough to only be treated with acupuncture, but also with cupping and needle pulling. masses Thus, the treatment can really reach the source of the disease completely, he said.
berita_id: Ketika orang menghadapi kenyataan bahwa perawatan medis, terutama untuk penyakit serius, harganya banyak, maka obat alternatif benar -benar menjadi pilihan.Selain biaya yang terjangkau, pengobatan alternatif tidak memerlukan tindakan medis yang bagi sebagian orang sangat menakutkan, seperti harus menjalani operasi.Sekarang ada banyak perawatan yang mengandalkan pengobatan timur, salah satunya adalah Drs H Ahmad Baraas, MSI di Jl Nuansa Timur Nomor 6, Nuansa Kori Housing, Ubung Kaja, Denpasar.Pria yang juga seorang jurnalis membuka praktik untuk pengobatan berbagai penyakit dengan menggunakan metode menarik jarum, akupunktur, cupping, obat herbal tradisional, elektro-magnetik dan bio-listrik.Baraas mempelajari kedokteran alternatif selusin tahun yang lalu.Pada awalnya ia belajar akupresur atau pijatan dengan tangannya, tetapi keterampilannya hanya digunakan untuk membantu sesama jurnalis yang kesehatannya terganggu ketika mereka melakukan liputan bersama.Bergairah membantu orang lain dan ingin memberikan hasil terapi maksimum, ia kemudian belajar bagaimana merawat dengan bekam, mengobati penyakit dengan merangsang titik saraf.Pria yang lahir di Jembrana, Bali juga tidak puas dengan pengetahuan terapeutiknya, jadi ia mengejar pengobatan menggunakan metode akupunktur, elektro-magnetik dan bio-listrik.Metode perawatan teknik magnetik elektro juga dikenal sebagai teknik tarik jarum.Baraas mempelajari akupunktur, penarik jarum dan bio-listrik dari terapis dari Sumenep, Madura, Drs Firman Taufiq.Dari penjaga Padepokan Citra Sumekar, ia juga belajar tentang obat -obatan dan ramuan Madure.Baraas mencampur beberapa bahan, dikombinasikan dengan ramuan dan rempah -rempah Bali.Di antara jadwalnya yang sibuk sebagai jurnalis, Baraas selalu menghabiskan waktunya merawat orang -orang yang membutuhkan bantuan untuk terapi dan dia biasanya merawat pasien setelah melaksanakan tugas pelaporannya sebagai jurnalis.Hasil terapi dikenali oleh sejumlah pasien dengan nyeri MAQ, bisul lambung, wasir, hernia, prostat, nyeri lutut, tekanan darah tinggi, stroke, insomnia, keseleo atau vena yang salah, kesemutan kronis, diabetes dan lainnya.Untuk penyakit ringan seperti demam, flu atau sakit kepala, biasanya dengan penyebaran ramuan di kepala, pasien dapat disembuhkan dalam beberapa saat.Namun, saya hanya perantara, Tuhan menyembuhkan, katanya.Berbicara tentang pengalamannya dirawat oleh Baraas, H Martiono (65) menyatakan bahwa ia sebelumnya telah dirawat di sejumlah tempat, termasuk menerima terapi akupunktur selama seminggu di klinik kedokteran alternatif di Jakarta.Tapi sekali lagi, gangguan tidur masalah tidak bisa hilang.Tetapi ketika dia mencoba pergi ke Baraas untuk perawatan, dia hanya menjalani satu terapi, sekarang dia bisa tidur selama lima jam sehari.Sebelumnya saya hanya tidur satu jam sehari, dari jam 11 malam sampai jam 12 siang.Saya sudah memilikinya selama bertahun -tahun.Alhamdulillah, sekarang saya bisa tidur sampai fajar, kata pemilik bisnis instalasi listrik.Pasien lain, Suarjaya (35), mengatakan dia akan membawa salah satu anggota keluarganya ke kediaman Baraas, yang merupakan tempat perawatan diberikan.Tetapi dia mengakui bahwa dia harus menelepon terlebih dahulu, karena dia ingin datang pada siang hari.Pria dari Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali mengakui bahwa perawatan di malam hari dilanda jarak jauh, sementara transportasi Karangasem-Denpasar, yang berjarak sekitar 90 kilometer, masih tidak halus.Suarjaya menceritakan bahwa dia secara tidak sengaja bertemu Baraas.Pada waktu itu dia mengalami demam dan menangkap influenza dan baraas yang di dekatnya ditawarkan untuk membantu dan ternyata dengan menggosok campuran di kepalanya, demamnya bisa disembuhkan.Itu sebabnya saya akan membawa keluarga saya yang sakit untuk perawatan ke Haji Baraas, katanya.Metode pengobatan yang diberikan oleh Baraas memang berbeda dari perawatan alternatif lainnya.Dia menggabungkan berbagai metode, mulai dari refleksi, bekam, gurah, tusuk jarum, menarik jarum ke bio-listrik.Ini direalisasikan karena setiap metode memiliki kelemahan untuk mengobati pasien dengan penyakit tertentu.Dengan menggunakan metode gabungan, berbagai kelemahan dapat ditutupi satu sama lain.Misalnya, untuk beberapa penyakit, tidak cukup hanya diobati dengan akupunktur, tetapi juga dengan bekam dan penarikan jarum.Misa dengan demikian, pengobatan ini benar -benar dapat mencapai sumber penyakit sepenuhnya, katanya.

berita: Spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Arrmanatha Nasir said his party was conducting an internal inspection regarding the run low burning of reog at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines. "Essentially, there has been an official statement from the Consulate General in Davao regarding the reog issue and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs also has an internal process to ensure that the goods are state agency assets," said Arrmanatha Nasir in Jakarta, Sunday (8/11). . On 20 October 2015, the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao issued an official statement that the destruction of Ponorogo reog by burning was carried out because its condition had been damaged and eaten by termites.
