berita_id: Kepala Bagian Informasi Umum Earpiece (Kabagpenum) dari Polisi Nasional, Kombes Pol.Martinus Sitompul, menekankan bahwa masalah lemparan Alquran oleh penjaga di cabang Mako Brimob Rutan Salemba, Jakarta Tengah pada hari Jumat, tidak benar."Tidak benar bahwa Alquran dilemparkan oleh penjaga," kata Kombes Martinus dalam sebuah pesan singkat, Jumat (11/10/2017) malam.Martinus menjelaskan bahwa apa yang terjadi adalah bahwa penjaga memeriksa sejumlah buku dan objek di sel penahanan.Menurutnya, kerusuhan yang terjadi pada hari Jumat sore dipicu oleh para tahanan yang tidak menerima pencarian petugas di kamar mereka."Gejolak yang terjadi adalah reaksi terhadap tindakan yang diambil oleh petugas penjaga yang menyita telepon seluler milik tahanan blok C," katanya.Selama pencarian, empat ponsel milik empat narapidana teroris ditemukan, yaitu Juhanda, Saulihun, Khairul Anam dan Jumali.Sejumlah narapidana Blok B dan Blok C kemudian memecahkan pintu sel.Tidak hanya itu, sejumlah fasilitas di Salemba Detention Center juga rusak, termasuk gerbang blok B dan lorong blok C dan jendela mereka.Martinus menambahkan bahwa kondisi penjara sekarang kembali menjadi kondusif."Pusat penahanan kondusif dan para tahanan tenang," katanya

berita: This is important information for all Muslims, especially in Indonesia, please spread this information. Recently, information was spread about one of the toothbrush products that contains pig bristles. If you find that the toothbrush package says "Bristle", it means that the toothbrush contains pig bristles. Sometimes it also says "Pure Bristle" and "100% China Bristle" Quoted from the Langitan.com magazine page, China Bristles means the same as Hog Bristles which means pet pigs. In addition to being used as an ingredient for toothbrushes, materials containing sea urchins are also used in bread brushes, wall paint, cosmetics and so on. According to one employee at the District Court (PN) of Tuban Regency, Bahyu Agung Kurniawan, that it is necessary to be careful because not all of these sea urchins have Bristles inscribed. Even though many scholars have different opinions about the issue of using sea requirement urchins, it is better to avoid it so that the scholars get out of disputes. And that is the best wara' attitude, which is to avoid brushes from sea urchins because the majority of scholars forbid their use. Based on the 2014 MUI fatwa, it was stated that it had forbidden the use of pig bristle brushes. And in 2016, the use of sea bristles already exists in toothbrush products. Wallahu a'lam...
berita_id: Ini adalah informasi penting untuk semua Muslim, terutama di Indonesia, silakan sebarkan informasi ini.Baru -baru ini, informasi tersebar tentang salah satu produk sikat gigi yang berisi bulu babi.Jika Anda menemukan bahwa paket sikat gigi mengatakan "bulu", itu berarti sikat gigi berisi bulu babi.Kadang -kadang juga mengatakan "bulu murni" dan "100% China Bristle" yang dikutip dari halaman majalah Langitan.com, China Bristles berarti sama dengan bulu babi yang berarti babi hewan peliharaan.Selain digunakan sebagai bahan untuk sikat gigi, bahan yang mengandung landak laut juga digunakan dalam sikat roti, cat dinding, kosmetik dan sebagainya.Menurut seorang karyawan di Pengadilan Distrik (PN) Kabupaten Tuban, Bahyu Agung Kurniawan, bahwa perlu untuk berhati -hati karena tidak semua bulu babi laut ini tertulis.Meskipun banyak sarjana memiliki pendapat berbeda tentang masalah penggunaan landak persyaratan laut, lebih baik menghindarinya sehingga para sarjana keluar dari perselisihan.Dan itu adalah sikap Wara terbaik, yaitu untuk menghindari kuas dari bulu babi karena mayoritas cendekiawan melarang penggunaannya.Berdasarkan MUI Fatwa 2014, dinyatakan bahwa ia telah melarang penggunaan sikat bulu babi.Dan pada tahun 2016, penggunaan bulu laut sudah ada dalam produk sikat gigi.Wallahu a'lam ...

berita: The Mojokerto City National Narcotics Agency (BNNK) and the Mojokerto City Health Office (Dinkes) East Java held a surprise inspection (sidak) of pacifiers suspected of containing hazardous materials, at a number of schools and snack food agents in Mojokerto City, Wednesday (08/3/2107 ). When conducting inspections at a number of schools, no candy sales were found. Next, the officers targeted a number of snack agents at the Tanjung Anyar Market, Mojokerto City. As a result, officers found candy with the same brand being sold freely at two snack food agencies. However, the type of candy found by the joint officers was different from the candy pacifier found in Surabaya. "Following up on the finding of candy allegedly containing drugs, today we conducted an inspection. As a result, we found candy with the same brand, namely "Hard Candy". But the shape is different," said Head of BNNK Mojokerto, AKBP Suharsi, Wednesday (08/3). /2017). In addition, officers also found candy pacifiers with different shapes. In Mojokerto, the candy pacifiers found resembled "kempeng". Officers also found imported sweets from China which were sold freely at a number of food agents at the Tanjung Anyar Market, take Mojokerto City. "Furthermore, we took samples of all the candies that we found, both candy with the "Hard Candy" brand and imported candies for laboratory testing. Even though these candies were equipped with a permit from the Food and Drug Administration (BPOM)," he said. .
berita_id: Badan Narkotika Nasional Kota Mojokerto (BNNK) dan Kantor Kesehatan Kota Mojokerto (Dinkes) Jawa Timur mengadakan inspeksi kejutan (SIDAK) dari dot yang diduga mengandung bahan berbahaya, di sejumlah sekolah dan agen makanan kudapan di Mocjokerto City, Rabu (08/3/2107).Saat melakukan inspeksi di sejumlah sekolah, tidak ada penjualan permen yang ditemukan.Selanjutnya, para petugas menargetkan sejumlah agen camilan di Pasar Tanjung Anyar, Mojokerto City.Akibatnya, petugas menemukan permen dengan merek yang sama dijual dengan bebas di dua agen makanan ringan.Namun, jenis permen yang ditemukan oleh petugas gabungan berbeda dari dot permen yang ditemukan di Surabaya."Menindaklanjuti temuan permen yang diduga mengandung obat -obatan, hari ini kami melakukan inspeksi. Akibatnya, kami menemukan permen dengan merek yang sama, yaitu" permen keras ". Tetapi bentuknya berbeda," kata kepala Bnnk Mojokerto, AKBP Suharsi, Rabu (08/3)./2017).Selain itu, petugas juga menemukan dot permen dengan bentuk yang berbeda.Di Mojokerto, dot permen menemukan "Kempeng".Petugas juga menemukan permen impor dari Cina yang dijual secara bebas di sejumlah agen makanan di pasar Tanjung Anyar, mengambil Kota Mojokerto."Selain itu, kami mengambil sampel dari semua permen yang kami temukan, keduanya permen dengan merek" permen keras "dan mengimpor permen untuk pengujian laboratorium. Meskipun permen ini dilengkapi dengan izin dari Food and Drug Administration (BPOM)," katanya..

berita: The raid on candy pacifiers indicated by drugs continues to be carried out by the Surabaya City government. There are three sub-district points that are moved by the Surabaya City Satpol PP to raid the green candy. Namely Genteng District, Rungkut District and Sawahan District. Sub-district Sawahan Surabaya City Yunus said raids had been carried out at three school points. "We raided SDN Pakis I, II, and IX on Jalan Pakistirtosari. The result was 20 teats," said Yunus. The pacifier is suspected to have drug content. Physically, the candy doesn't look like drugs, but rather like regular candy. "Those who sell it at street vendors around the school are immediately secured. We secure them and take them to the sub-district office," said Yunus. Not only pacifiers, but in the food and beverage raids at a number of elementary schools in Sawahan, a number of hard candies were also found. Namely candy that contains formaldehyde which  is dangerous if consumed by children. "For hard candy, there are 33 seeds and 17 packs of hard candy in tablet form. We also secure that," said Yunus.
berita_id: Penggerebekan dot permen yang ditunjukkan oleh narkoba terus dilakukan oleh pemerintah kota Surabaya.Ada tiga poin sub-distrik yang dipindahkan oleh Surabaya City Satpol PP untuk menyerang permen hijau.Yaitu Distrik Genteng, Distrik Rungkut dan Distrik Sawahan.Sub-distrik Sawahan Surabaya City Yunus mengatakan serangan telah dilakukan di tiga titik sekolah."Kami menggerebek Sdn Pakis I, II, dan IX di Jalan Pakistirtosari. Hasilnya adalah 20 dadah," kata Yunus.Dot diduga memiliki kandungan narkoba.Secara fisik, permen itu tidak terlihat seperti obat -obatan, tetapi lebih seperti permen biasa."Mereka yang menjualnya di pedagang kaki lima di sekitar sekolah segera diamankan. Kami mengamankannya dan membawanya ke kantor sub-distrik," kata Yunus.Tidak hanya dot, tetapi dalam serangan makanan dan minuman di sejumlah sekolah dasar di Sawahan, sejumlah permen keras juga ditemukan.Yaitu permen yang mengandung formaldehida yang berbahaya jika dikonsumsi oleh anak -anak."Untuk permen keras, ada 33 biji dan 17 bungkus permen keras dalam bentuk tablet. Kami juga mengamankannya," kata Yunus.

berita: Netizens are busy talking about social media, Facebook in Indonesia will be closed on April 24, 2018. Is that right? We tried to find out the truth of the news, it turned out to be a hoax or not true. So far, there has been no firm statement from the Ministry of user Communication and Information (Kemenkominfo) confirming that Facebook Indonesia will be blocked or closed on April 24, 2018. However, the Ministry of Communication and Information does not hesitate to block Facebook in Indonesia like Telegram, if it is proven that there is a criminal element in the leakage of Facebook user data in Indonesia. If indeed Facebook Indonesia will be blocked, even then it will only be temporary and if the situation gets worse. "We will see this situation first. If it gets worse, we will close temporarily," said Minister of Communication and Informatics Rudiantara, Wednesday (11/4/2018) at the Kominfo Building, Medan Merdeka, Jakarta. "If there are indications that Facebook in Indonesia is being used for incitement, as happened in Myanmar, I have no qualms about blocking it," added Rudiantara. Reported by CNN Indonesia, the Facebook data leak scandal in Indonesia recorded as many as 1,095,918 users who could potentially be affected by data abuse. From November 2013 to 2015 there were 748 people in Indonesia who installed thisisyourdigitallife application. The application, which is a personality test quiz, is known to use Facebook account access. "There are a total of 1,096,666 people in Indonesia or around 1.26 percent of the total number of people affected globally," explained Facebook Indonesia's Head of Public Policy Ruben Hattari during a Hearing Meeting (RDP) with members of Commission I of the Indonesian House of Representatives in Jakarta, Tuesday (17/4). According to Ruben, the figure is known to not include people who have downloaded the application, but then deleted their Facebook account. The company owned by Mark Zuckerberg claims not to store the data of individual users who download the application. To note, there are about 87 million global Facebook user data stolen by Cambridge Analytica (CA). Indonesia occupies the third position as the country with the most user data victims.
berita_id: Netizen sibuk berbicara tentang media sosial, Facebook di Indonesia akan ditutup pada 24 April 2018. Apakah itu benar?Kami mencoba mencari tahu kebenaran berita itu, ternyata itu adalah tipuan atau tidak benar.Sejauh ini, belum ada pernyataan tegas dari Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informasi Pengguna (Kemenkominfo) yang mengkonfirmasi bahwa Facebook Indonesia akan diblokir atau ditutup pada 24 April 2018. Namun, Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informasi tidak ragu untuk memblokir Facebook di Indonesia seperti Telegram, jika terbukti bahwa ada elemen kriminal dalam leahage di Facebook di Facebook.Jika memang Facebook Indonesia akan diblokir, meskipun itu hanya akan bersifat sementara dan jika situasinya semakin buruk."Kami akan melihat situasi ini terlebih dahulu. Jika semakin buruk, kami akan menutup sementara," kata Menteri Komunikasi dan Informatika Rudiantara, Rabu (11/4/2018) di gedung Kepomo, Medan Merdeka, Jakarta."Jika ada indikasi bahwa Facebook di Indonesia digunakan untuk hasutan, seperti yang terjadi di Myanmar, saya tidak punya keraguan tentang memblokirnya," tambah Rudiantara.Dilaporkan oleh CNN Indonesia, skandal kebocoran data Facebook di Indonesia mencatat sebanyak 1.095.918 pengguna yang berpotensi dipengaruhi oleh penyalahgunaan data.Dari November 2013 hingga 2015 ada 748 orang di Indonesia yang memasang aplikasi ThisisyyourDigitallife.Aplikasi, yang merupakan kuis tes kepribadian, diketahui menggunakan akses akun Facebook."Ada total 1.096.666 orang di Indonesia atau sekitar 1,26 persen dari jumlah total orang yang terkena dampak global," jelas kepala kebijakan publik Ruben Hattari di Indonesia di Indonesia selama pertemuan pendengaran (RDP) dengan anggota Komisi I dari Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Indonesia di Jakarta, Selasa (17/4).Menurut Ruben, angka tersebut diketahui tidak termasuk orang yang telah mengunduh aplikasi, tetapi kemudian menghapus akun Facebook mereka.Perusahaan yang dimiliki oleh Mark Zuckerberg mengklaim tidak menyimpan data pengguna individu yang mengunduh aplikasi.Untuk dicatat, ada sekitar 87 juta data pengguna Global Facebook yang dicuri oleh Cambridge Analytica (CA).Indonesia menempati posisi ketiga sebagai negara dengan korban data pengguna terbanyak.

berita: Supporters of the Governor of DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan vented their frustration regarding the walk out during the 90th anniversary of the founding of Kanisius College, which has a long tail. The Traveloka e-commerce application seems to have been affected by the walk out action initiated by composer Ananda Sukarlan. Anies' supporters voiced their voice for the Traveloka boycott on Twitter. As a result, the hashtag #UninstallTraveloka became a trending topic on Tuesday (11/14/2017). Investigate, Traveloka was dragged along because there was a figure of Derianto Kusuma there. The Traveloka boss, who is also an alumni of Kanisius College, is said to have supported the action of WO Ananda Sukarlan Cs. This is as quoted from the JPNN.com report, Wednesday 15/11/2017). In response to this, Anies asked netizens not to judge Derianto and attack Traveloka. This is because different political views are normal. "So let's get used to different views. Many things respect each other, respect without having to carry out punishments like that, so there is  no need for an uninstall," Anies explained in order to ease the annoyance of his supporters at DKI Jakarta City Hall, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (14/11/2017). Personally, Anies admitted that he had no problem with Derianto's attitude. In his opinion, the DKI Provincial Government does not need to take action to uninstall the Traveloka application. Especially considering the application is very useful for many people. “In my opinion, we respect people with different views, there is no need to uninstall. Because Traveloka also provides benefits for many citizens. It has many services, great benefits for many people," Anies concluded. Meanwhile, Traveloka Management dismissed the accusations by supporters of DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan to CTO Derianto Kusuma. According to Traveloka, Derianto had absolutely nothing to do with the walkout at the 90th anniversary of the founding of Kanisius College last weekend. Busyra Oryza as PR Manager of Traveloka said, Traveloka is a technology-based company founded by the sons and daughters of the Indonesian nation that puts forward the values ​​of mutual respect, tolerance and innovation. These values ​​are always applied to employees and external stakeholders. "We are also proud that one of our founders, Mr. Derianto Kusuma, received an award from the Kanisius Alumni," said Busyra when confirmed by reporters on Tuesday (11/14/2017), launching JawaPos.com. Regarding the news on social media linking Derianto with WO a number of Kanisius alumni, it was confirmed that it was not true or a hoax. Because, Busyra emphasized, Derianto did not attend the event which took place at JIExpo Kemayoran. He revealed that at that time Derianto was on an official trip that had been planned several months in advance. "He was unable to attend. However, this award further motivates us to increase our contribution to society by increasing mobility and improving the quality of life," he said. With this statement, Busyra continued, Traveloka has firmly rejected the issues circulating on social media. “The statement already covers the points that the public needs to know. We hope that this can provide an explanation of the issues that are happening," he explained. Previously, Twitter social media was bustling with tweets of the Traveloka boycott. Even #UninstallTraveloka was at the top of Twitter's trending topic. The conversation emerged as the aftermath of the Walk Out (WO) action of the famous Indonesian composer, Ananda Sukarlan when the Governor of DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan gave a speech at the 90th anniversary of the establishment of Kanisius College at JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta, Saturday (11/11/2017). From the rumors circulating, when Anies Baswedan gave a speech, Ananda suddenly stood up and then WO went out of the room. It is said that one of the founders and CTO of Traveloka, Derianto Kusuma, who was present at the event, also greeted Ananda after the walk out and Anies' speech. This was seen as support for Ananda's actions. However, the issue was finally clarified by Traveloka that Derianto was unable to attend at that time.
berita_id: Pendukung Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan melampiaskan frustrasi mereka mengenai perjalanan keluar selama peringatan 90 tahun pendirian Kanisius College, yang memiliki ekor panjang.Aplikasi e-commerce Traveloka tampaknya telah dipengaruhi oleh tindakan berjalan yang diprakarsai oleh komposer Ananda Sukarlan.Para pendukung Anies menyuarakan suara mereka untuk boikot Traveloka di Twitter.Akibatnya, tagar #uninstalltraveloka menjadi topik yang sedang tren pada hari Selasa (11/14/2017).Selidiki, Traveloka diseret bersama karena ada sosok DeRianto Kusuma di sana.Bos Traveloka, yang juga merupakan alumni dari Kanisius College, dikatakan telah mendukung aksi WO Ananda Sukarlan CS.Ini seperti dikutip dari laporan JPNN.com, Rabu 15/11/2017).Menanggapi hal ini, Anies meminta netizen untuk tidak menilai Derianto dan menyerang Traveloka.Ini karena pandangan politik yang berbeda adalah normal."Jadi mari kita terbiasa dengan pandangan yang berbeda. Banyak hal saling menghormati, rasa hormat tanpa harus melakukan hukuman seperti itu, jadi tidak perlu menghapus instalan," jelas Anies untuk meringankan gangguan pendukungnya di Balai Kota DKI Jakarta, Jakarta Tengah, Selasa (14/11/2017).Secara pribadi, Anies mengakui bahwa dia tidak punya masalah dengan sikap Deraianto.Menurut pendapatnya, pemerintah provinsi DKI tidak perlu mengambil tindakan untuk menghapus aplikasi Traveloka.Terutama mengingat aplikasi ini sangat berguna bagi banyak orang.“Menurut saya, kami menghormati orang -orang dengan pandangan yang berbeda, tidak perlu menghapus instalasi. Karena Traveloka juga memberikan manfaat bagi banyak warga. Ini memiliki banyak layanan, manfaat besar bagi banyak orang,” pungkas Anies.Sementara itu, manajemen Traveloka menolak tuduhan oleh para pendukung Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan ke CTO DeRianto Kusuma.Menurut Traveloka, DeRianto sama sekali tidak ada hubungannya dengan pemogokan pada peringatan 90 tahun pendirian Kanisius College akhir pekan lalu.Busyra Oryza sebagai manajer PR Traveloka mengatakan, Traveloka adalah perusahaan berbasis teknologi yang didirikan oleh putra dan putri negara Indonesia yang mengedepankan nilai-nilai rasa saling menghormati, toleransi, dan inovasi.Nilai -nilai ini selalu diterapkan pada karyawan dan pemangku kepentingan eksternal."Kami juga bangga bahwa salah satu pendiri kami, Mr. DeRianto Kusuma, menerima penghargaan dari alumni Kanisius," kata Busyra ketika dikonfirmasi oleh wartawan pada hari Selasa (11/14/2017), meluncurkan Jawapos.com.Mengenai berita di media sosial yang menghubungkan DeRianto dengan WO sejumlah alumni Kanisius, dikonfirmasi bahwa itu tidak benar atau tipuan.Karena, Busyra menekankan, DeRianto tidak menghadiri acara yang berlangsung di Jiexpo Kemayoran.Dia mengungkapkan bahwa pada saat itu Derianto sedang dalam perjalanan resmi yang telah direncanakan beberapa bulan sebelumnya."Dia tidak dapat hadir. Namun, penghargaan ini semakin memotivasi kami untuk meningkatkan kontribusi kami kepada masyarakat dengan meningkatkan mobilitas dan meningkatkan kualitas hidup," katanya.Dengan pernyataan ini, Busyra melanjutkan, Traveloka dengan tegas menolak masalah yang beredar di media sosial."Pernyataan itu sudah mencakup poin -poin yang perlu diketahui publik. Kami berharap ini dapat memberikan penjelasan tentang masalah yang sedang terjadi," jelasnya.Sebelumnya, media sosial Twitter ramai dengan tweet boikot Traveloka.Bahkan #uninstalltraveloka ada di puncak topik tren Twitter.Percakapan muncul sebagai aksi aksi Walk Out (WO) dari komposer Indonesia yang terkenal, Ananda Sukarlan ketika gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan memberikan pidato pada peringatan 90 tahun pendirian Kanisius di Jiexpo Kemayoran, Jakara, Sabtu, 11) di Jiexpo Kemayoran, Jakara, Sabtu, JiExpo Kemayoran, Jakara, Jixpo Kemayoran, Jixpo, Jiexpo Kemayoran, Jixpo Kemayoran, Jixpo.Dari rumor yang beredar, ketika Anies Baswedan memberikan pidato, Ananda tiba -tiba berdiri dan kemudian akan keluar dari ruangan.Dikatakan bahwa salah satu pendiri dan CTO Traveloka, DeRianto Kusuma, yang hadir di acara tersebut, juga menyambut Ananda setelah pidato berjalan dan anies.Ini dipandang sebagai dukungan untuk tindakan Ananda.Namun, masalah ini akhirnya diklarifikasi oleh Traveloka bahwa DeRianto tidak dapat hadir pada waktu itu.

berita: Participants of Action 212 Volume 2 who came from outside the city had arrived at the Istiqlal Mosque, but they could not enter because the gate of the mosque was locked. According to observations, hundreds of mobs driving 5 bosses, including AD number plates (Solo and its surroundings) were stuck at the entrance follow of the Istiqlal mosque, Monday (20/2) night, as the mosque, which used to be the gathering place for the Defending Islam Action, was previously closed. Police officers on guard in front of the Istiqlal Mosque then directed the bus from the area to another place. It was not explained where the mass gathering place was diverted. Previously, the Islamic Community Forum (FUI) ensured that there would be no long march during the 212th volume II action, Tuesday (21/2) tomorrow. Action participants will be directed directly to the action concentration point in front of the DPR/MPR RI building. “Our scenario is that there is no long march. So, all participants are advised to go directly to the DPR/MPR RI building," said Ustaz Bernard Abdul Jabbar as coordinator of the 212 action volume II to reporters at the Metro Jaya Police Headquarters, Jakarta. Ustadz Bernard estimates that 10 thousand people will attend the action. People from outside Jakarta were asked to park their vehicles in the parking lots that have been prepared. “And for those from areas who bring buses and vehicles, we then direct them to park at the Senayan East Parking if they are from the south and east. Meanwhile, from the west, we will direct them to (park vehicles) at Palmerah Station and in front of the Ministry of Forestry building,” he explained. He added that his party also did not provide lodging facilities for action participants from outside the region. This means that those from outside the city of Jakarta are welcome to find a place to rest on their own.
berita_id: Peserta aksi 212 Volume 2 yang datang dari luar kota telah tiba di masjid Istiqlal, tetapi mereka tidak bisa masuk karena gerbang masjid terkunci.Menurut pengamatan, ratusan gerombolan yang mengendarai 5 bos, termasuk pelat nomor iklan (solo dan sekitarnya) terjebak di pintu masuk mengikuti masjid Istiqlal, Senin (20/2) malam, sebagai masjid, yang dulunya adalah tempat berkumpul untuk tindakan Islam yang bertahan, sebelumnya ditutup.Petugas polisi yang berjaga di depan masjid Istiqlal kemudian mengarahkan bus dari daerah ke tempat lain.Itu tidak dijelaskan di mana tempat pengumpulan massa dialihkan.Sebelumnya, Forum Komunitas Islam (FUI) memastikan bahwa tidak akan ada Maret yang panjang selama aksi Volume II ke -212, Selasa (21/2) besok.Peserta tindakan akan diarahkan langsung ke titik konsentrasi aksi di depan gedung DPR/MPR RI."Skenario kami adalah bahwa tidak ada pawai yang lama. Jadi, semua peserta disarankan untuk langsung pergi ke gedung DPR/MPR RI," kata Ustaz Bernard Abdul Jabbar sebagai koordinator 212 Action Volume II kepada wartawan di markas kepolisian Metro Jaya, Jakarta.Ustadz Bernard memperkirakan bahwa 10 ribu orang akan menghadiri aksi tersebut.Orang -orang dari luar Jakarta diminta memarkir kendaraan mereka di tempat parkir yang telah disiapkan.“Dan bagi mereka yang berasal dari daerah yang membawa bus dan kendaraan, kami kemudian mengarahkan mereka ke parkir di parkir Senayan Timur jika mereka berasal dari selatan dan timur. Sementara itu, dari barat, kami akan mengarahkan mereka ke (parkir kendaraan) di Stasiun Palmerah dan di depan Kementerian Kehutanan,” jelasnya.Dia menambahkan bahwa partainya juga tidak menyediakan fasilitas penginapan bagi peserta tindakan dari luar wilayah.Ini berarti bahwa orang -orang dari luar kota Jakarta dipersilakan untuk menemukan tempat untuk beristirahat sendiri.

berita: Last week, reports emerged that the iPhone 6 Plus could bend easily if kept in the pocket for too long. A number of videos of the iPhone 6 Plus body endurance test immediately appeared on YouTube. The majority of them came to the same conclusion, the iPhone 6 Plus bends easily! Since then the case has been known as the 'Bendgate' or 'curved scandal', and has become a hot topic of debate on social media. To prove the truth, a talk show on Bloomberg TV also invited several expert sources to reveal the truth. One of the experts who was given the opportunity to explain was Lewis Hilsenteger, owner of the Unbox Therapy channel on YouTube, who is suspected of being the first uploader of the trial video for bending the body of the iPhone 6 Plus. Speaking live via web cam with Bloomberg Tv, Hilsenteger said, "The fact is that I tried not only to bend one iPhone 6 Plus, but respective several. This was in order to make the published video show convincing results." He further explained that from the several units he tried to bend, there was one identical feature. "I've tried bending 3 units, all curved in the same location, which is just below the volume buttons," said Hilsenteger.
berita_id: Pekan lalu, laporan muncul bahwa iPhone 6 Plus dapat menekuk dengan mudah jika disimpan di saku terlalu lama.Sejumlah video uji daya tahan body iPhone 6 Plus segera muncul di YouTube.Mayoritas dari mereka sampai pada kesimpulan yang sama, iPhone 6 plus tikungan dengan mudah!Sejak itu kasus ini telah dikenal sebagai 'bendgate' atau 'skandal melengkung', dan telah menjadi topik panas perdebatan di media sosial.Untuk membuktikan kebenaran, acara bincang -bincang di Bloomberg TV juga mengundang beberapa sumber ahli untuk mengungkapkan kebenaran.Salah satu ahli yang diberi kesempatan untuk menjelaskan adalah Lewis Hilsenteger, pemilik saluran terapi Unbox di YouTube, yang diduga sebagai pengunggah pertama dari video uji coba untuk menekuk tubuh iPhone 6 Plus.Berbicara langsung melalui web cam dengan Bloomberg TV, Hilsenteger mengatakan, "Faktanya adalah saya mencoba tidak hanya untuk menekuk satu iPhone 6 Plus, tetapi masing -masing beberapa. Ini untuk membuat video yang dipublikasikan meyakinkan hasil yang meyakinkan."Dia lebih lanjut menjelaskan bahwa dari beberapa unit yang dia coba tekuk, ada satu fitur yang identik."Saya sudah mencoba membengkokkan 3 unit, semuanya melengkung di lokasi yang sama, yang tepat di bawah tombol volume," kata Hilsenteger.

berita: The Istiqlal Mosque Management Agency (BPPMI) straightened the information circulating on social media regarding the closing of the gate for visitors the night before the 212 Action. According to the Secretary of BPPMI KH Rusli Effendi, since 2002, his party has enforced a rule to close all gates every night at 21.30 WIB and reopen them at 03.40 WIB before security system the Fajr prayer. "All pilgrims are not allowed to stay in the mosque area except under certain conditions and with permission from the security forces and the leadership of BPPMI," said Rusli in Jakarta, Tuesday (21/2). Regarding the conditions at night from 20 until the early hours of February 21, the security of the Istiqlal Mosque had explained to the congregation (participants of the 212 action) who had gathered in the mosque's courtyard about the procedure. "They understand and are willing to leave the mosque area," he said. According to Rusli, BPPMI did not receive notification from any party regarding the plans for the congregation to stay overnight as in the previous conditions when Muslims held 411, 212 or 112 actions. There was also no special communication from the authorities regarding this matter. "The Istiqlal Mosque is always devoted to the people and strives for national unity and unity and always maintains the comfort of worship. We urge all Muslims not to be influenced by news that cannot be accounted for," he concluded.
berita_id: Badan Manajemen Masjid Istiqlal (BPPMI) meluruskan informasi yang beredar di media sosial mengenai penutupan gerbang bagi pengunjung malam sebelum aksi 212.Menurut Sekretaris Bppmi Kh Rusli Effendi, sejak tahun 2002, partainya telah menegakkan aturan untuk menutup semua gerbang setiap malam pukul 21.30 WIB dan membukanya kembali pada 03.40 WIB sebelum sistem keamanan doa Fajr."Semua peziarah tidak diizinkan untuk tinggal di daerah masjid kecuali dalam kondisi tertentu dan dengan izin dari pasukan keamanan dan kepemimpinan BPPMI," kata Rusli di Jakarta, Selasa (21/2).Mengenai kondisi di malam hari dari 20 hingga jam awal 21 Februari, keamanan masjid Istiqlal telah menjelaskan kepada jemaat (peserta aksi 212) yang telah berkumpul di halaman masjid tentang prosedur tersebut."Mereka mengerti dan bersedia meninggalkan daerah masjid," katanya.Menurut Rusli, BPPMI tidak menerima pemberitahuan dari pihak mana pun mengenai rencana jemaat untuk menginap seperti dalam kondisi sebelumnya ketika Muslim memegang 411, 212 atau 112 tindakan.Juga tidak ada komunikasi khusus dari pihak berwenang mengenai masalah ini."Masjid Istiqlal selalu dikhususkan untuk orang -orang dan berusaha untuk persatuan dan persatuan nasional dan selalu mempertahankan kenyamanan ibadah. Kami mendesak semua Muslim untuk tidak dipengaruhi oleh berita yang tidak dapat diperhitungkan," pungkasnya.

berita: A netizen shared news of the riots that occurred at the Mako Brimob Rutan, Depok. The news circulating take widely on social media said that the rioting started after the prison officers threw the Koran. There has been a riot at the Headquarters of Brimob Kelapa Dua, two depots where terrorist prisoners burned and destroyed the room because the guard Ahmad and his team threw the Koran and caused the prisoners to go berserk. The chronology of the beginning of the riots is also written. The cause of the incident that spread was that Karutan and Brimob came to the isolation rooms of the asatidz, then they ransacked the rooms of the clerics to look for cellphones even though there was a cleric who was sick and they didn't care. The peak of Ikhwah's anger was when Brimob shuffled books of monotheism and threw books and the Koran. Then the brothers who did not accept takbir because they did not accept the Brimob treatment that abused Asatidz and the Koran. After the ikhwah shouted takbir, the Brimob shouted YOU ALL DOG Then they beat some of our brothers, and that's where the anger of the brothers caused a riot in the prison. The riots at the detention center and Brimob had fired several warning shots at the brothers who were out of control because the Koran was being abused. POLRI'S OFFICIAL RESPONSE The rioting took place at the Brimob Mako Rutan, Depok, West Java, this afternoon. According to the police, the trigger was that there were prisoners who did not accept being examined and provoked a commotion. According to Karo Penmas, Police Public Relations Division, Brigadier General Rikwanto, a commotion occurred at the Mako Brimob terrorist detention center at the Salemba detention center, Depok, West Java, this afternoon at around 16.00 WIB, Friday (11/10/2017). Rikwanto explained that after Friday prayers, the detainees were put into their respective cells by the Densus 88 team. While carrying out these activities, the Densus 88 team conducted a search. There are 4 pieces of HP found. "Four cellphones were found. They belonged to Juhanda, Saulihun, Kairul Anam, and Jumali," he said. detikcom notes, they are convicts of terrorism cases. One of the detainees did not accept the search. According to Rikwanto, the detainee who was not named then made a provocation. "It is true that with the inspection activities, one of the prisoners did not accept it and provoked the officers with various words, then some members were provoked by their words and there were prisoners who were takbir loudly so that they provoked the prisoners of the next block," he explained. As a result, riots ensued. A number of facilities in the prison were damaged by the inmates. "The prison cell door was broken into, the gate of the block hallway, the window panes (in Block C and Block B)," said Rikwanto. But it didn't last long. The apparatus, according to Rikwanto, immediately took control of the situation. Rikwanto also denied that there was a wild issue on social media that said this incident was triggered by the throwing of the Koran by the authorities. "Hoax," he insisted.
berita_id: Netizen berbagi berita tentang kerusuhan yang terjadi di Mako Brimob Rutan, Depok.Berita yang beredar secara luas di media sosial mengatakan bahwa kerusuhan dimulai setelah petugas penjara melemparkan Alquran.Ada kerusuhan di markas Brimob Kelapa Dua, dua depot di mana tahanan teroris membakar dan menghancurkan ruangan itu karena penjaga Ahmad dan timnya melemparkan Alquran dan menyebabkan para tahanan mengamuk.Kronologi awal kerusuhan juga ditulis.Penyebab kejadian yang menyebar adalah bahwa Karutan dan Brimob datang ke ruang isolasi Asatidz, kemudian mereka menggeledah kamar -kamar ulama untuk mencari ponsel meskipun ada ulama yang sakit dan mereka tidak peduli.Puncak kemarahan Ikhwah adalah ketika Brimob mengocok buku -buku monoteisme dan melemparkan buku dan Alquran.Kemudian saudara -saudara yang tidak menerima Takbir karena mereka tidak menerima perlakuan Brimob yang melecehkan Asatidz dan Alquran.Setelah Ikhwah meneriakkan Takbir, brimob meneriakkan Anda semua anjing kemudian mereka mengalahkan beberapa saudara kita, dan di situlah kemarahan saudara -saudara menyebabkan kerusuhan di penjara.Kerusuhan di pusat penahanan dan Brimob telah menembakkan beberapa tembakan peringatan pada saudara -saudara yang di luar kendali karena Alquran dilecehkan.Tanggapan resmi Polri, kerusuhan itu terjadi di Brimob Mako Rutan, Depok, Jawa Barat, sore ini.Menurut polisi, pemicunya adalah bahwa ada tahanan yang tidak menerima diperiksa dan memicu keributan.Menurut Karo Penmas, Divisi Hubungan Masyarakat Polisi, Brigadir Jenderal Rikwanto, keributan terjadi di Pusat Penahanan Teroris Mako Brimob di Pusat Penahanan Salemba, Depok, Jawa Barat, sore ini sekitar 16.00 WIB, Jumat (11/10/2017).Rikwanto menjelaskan bahwa setelah doa Jumat, para tahanan dimasukkan ke dalam sel masing -masing oleh tim Densus 88.Saat melakukan kegiatan ini, tim Densus 88 melakukan pencarian.Ada 4 potong HP yang ditemukan."Empat ponsel ditemukan. Mereka milik Juhanda, Saulihun, Kairul Anam, dan Jumali," katanya.Detikcom mencatat, mereka adalah narapidana kasus terorisme.Salah satu tahanan tidak menerima pencarian.Menurut Rikwanto, tahanan yang tidak dinamai kemudian membuat provokasi."Memang benar bahwa dengan kegiatan inspeksi, salah satu tahanan tidak menerimanya dan memprovokasi para petugas dengan berbagai kata, kemudian beberapa anggota diprovokasi oleh kata -kata mereka dan ada tahanan yang Takbir dengan keras sehingga mereka memicu tahanan blok berikutnya," jelasnya.Akibatnya, kerusuhan terjadi.Sejumlah fasilitas di penjara rusak oleh para tahanan."Pintu sel penjara dipecah, gerbang lorong blok, panel jendela (di blok C dan blok B)," kata Rikwanto.Tapi itu tidak bertahan lama.Peralatan, menurut Rikwanto, segera mengendalikan situasi.Rikwanto juga membantah bahwa ada masalah liar di media sosial yang mengatakan kejadian ini dipicu oleh lemparan Alquran oleh pihak berwenang."Berbagai arah," tegasnya.

berita: Facebook is again a byword in the world, including in Indonesia. In fact, Facebook is threatened with closure by the Indonesian government. The cause, especially if not an indication of the leakage of customer personal data to a third company, Cambridge Analytica. This leak is also very large. To date, there have been 87 million personal data leaked. The data that Facebook collects is even up to short messages (SMS) and cell phone records of Facebook account owners. In Indonesia, the Facebook data leak has also been in the spotlight of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology. The Minister of Communication and Information, Rudiantara, said that Facebook could be threatened with administrative and criminal sanctions if it is proven to have violated the law. ministry Minister Rudiantara firmly emphasized that his party would not hesitate to close the social media Facebook. There are two serious violations committed by Facebook. First, about the data leak of 1 million account owners from Indonesia. Second, Mark Zuckerberg's social media is suspected of being one of the social media platforms for spreading hoax news and propaganda. As quoted from The Guardian, Facebook admits that its media is used as an anti-Rohing propaganda tool in Myanmar. "I take a position, I threaten to close Facebook and the government has no doubts if it has to close Facebook if it is used for hacking," said Minister Rudiantara. Don't Just Take Action Regarding the two alleged big mistakes by Facebook, the Ministry of Communication and Information will not just take action. The ministry will investigate together with the relevant agencies. The government's actions will have to be based on the right reasons. "I'm coordinating with the police. If I take legal action in cyberspace. Later, if it is processed, there will be a process at the police," said Rudiantara. Rudiantara added that regarding data leakage, Facebook could be subject to corporal sanctions of up to 12 years and a fine of up to Rp12 billion. The reprimand against Facebook is not the first time. In November 2016, the Directorate General of Taxes said that Facebook's tax debt in Indonesia reached IDR 3 trillion. Facebook was also reprimanded by the Ministry of Communication and Information about content that must comply with regulations in Indonesia. “All social media must be willing to participate in maintaining the stability of the country if they want to do business in Indonesia. If it destabilizes Indonesia, the government will act decisively," said the Minister of Communication and Informatics.
berita_id: Facebook sekali lagi menjadi kata bibir di dunia, termasuk di Indonesia.Bahkan, Facebook terancam penutupan oleh pemerintah Indonesia.Penyebabnya, terutama jika bukan indikasi kebocoran data pribadi pelanggan kepada perusahaan ketiga, Cambridge Analytica.Kebocoran ini juga sangat besar.Sampai saat ini, ada 87 juta data pribadi bocor.Data yang dikumpulkan Facebook bahkan hingga pesan pendek (SMS) dan catatan ponsel pemilik akun Facebook.Di Indonesia, kebocoran data Facebook juga menjadi sorotan dari Kementerian Komunikasi dan Teknologi Informasi.Menteri Komunikasi dan Informasi, Rudiantara, mengatakan bahwa Facebook dapat diancam dengan sanksi administrasi dan pidana jika terbukti telah melanggar hukum.Menteri Kementerian Rudiantara dengan tegas menekankan bahwa partainya tidak akan ragu untuk menutup media sosial Facebook.Ada dua pelanggaran serius yang dilakukan oleh Facebook.Pertama, tentang kebocoran data 1 juta pemilik akun dari Indonesia.Kedua, media sosial Mark Zuckerberg dicurigai sebagai salah satu platform media sosial untuk menyebarkan berita dan propaganda tipuan.Seperti dikutip dari The Guardian, Facebook mengakui bahwa medianya digunakan sebagai alat propaganda anti-rok di Myanmar."Saya mengambil posisi, saya mengancam untuk menutup Facebook dan pemerintah tidak memiliki keraguan jika harus menutup Facebook jika digunakan untuk peretasan," kata Menteri Rudiantara.Jangan hanya mengambil tindakan mengenai dua dugaan kesalahan besar oleh Facebook, Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informasi tidak akan hanya mengambil tindakan.Kementerian akan menyelidiki bersama dengan lembaga yang relevan.Tindakan pemerintah harus didasarkan pada alasan yang tepat."Saya berkoordinasi dengan polisi. Jika saya mengambil tindakan hukum di dunia maya. Kemudian, jika diproses, akan ada proses di polisi," kata Rudiiantara.Rudiantara menambahkan bahwa mengenai kebocoran data, Facebook dapat dikenakan sanksi fisik hingga 12 tahun dan denda hingga Rp12 miliar.Reprimand terhadap Facebook bukan pertama kalinya.Pada November 2016, Direktorat Jenderal Pajak mengatakan bahwa utang pajak Facebook di Indonesia mencapai IDR 3 triliun.Facebook juga ditegur oleh Kementerian Komunikasi dan informasi tentang konten yang harus mematuhi peraturan di Indonesia.“Semua media sosial harus bersedia untuk berpartisipasi dalam menjaga stabilitas negara jika mereka ingin melakukan bisnis di Indonesia. Jika itu mengacaukan Indonesia, pemerintah akan bertindak dengan tegas,” kata Menteri Komunikasi dan Informatika.

berita: Currently circulating a toothbrush that turns out to be made from one part of the pig's body, namely the fur. The way to find it is to look on the toothbrush package to see if it says "China Bristles" or "Bristles". punk China Bristles is another name for sea urchins and is produced mostly by the Chinese region of China. We must know this because it is based on Imam Syafii's opinion that brushes made of sea urchins are unclean. Pig bristles are indeed the choice of toothbrush manufacturers because the price of the material is cheaper than synthetic bristles. Manufacturers only have to collect, clean and cut them. China is indeed a place that stocks a lot of pork skins because pork is considered halal by its people for consumption. It's not just a toothbrush that we have to watch out for, but a paint brush or a brush for greasing cakes must also be a concern for us as Muslims. A real example is the case of the Eterna brand brush which has been tested by LPPOM and the results are positive using sea urchins. Apart from looking at the packaging, there is another way to find out, namely by burning it. If the brush or brush smells bad, it's most likely using pig bristles. According to Imam Syafii, brushes made from pig bristles used to paint mosques will make the mosque covered with uncleanness and must be removed immediately. Moreover, if the sea urchin becomes a toothbrush that we use every day. Therefore, be careful and continue to be vigilant against various products that can bring harm to us as Muslims.
berita_id: Saat ini mengedarkan sikat gigi yang ternyata dibuat dari satu bagian tubuh babi, yaitu bulu.Cara untuk menemukannya adalah dengan melihat paket sikat gigi untuk melihat apakah dikatakan "bulu Cina" atau "bulu".Punk China Bristles adalah nama lain untuk landak laut dan sebagian besar diproduksi oleh wilayah Cina di Tiongkok.Kita harus mengetahui hal ini karena didasarkan pada pendapat Imam Syafii bahwa kuas yang terbuat dari landak laut adalah najis.Babi babi memang merupakan pilihan produsen sikat gigi karena harga bahan lebih murah daripada bulu sintetis.Produsen hanya perlu mengumpulkan, membersihkan, dan memotongnya.China memang merupakan tempat yang menyediakan banyak kulit babi karena babi dianggap halal oleh orang -orangnya untuk dikonsumsi.Bukan hanya sikat gigi yang harus kita waspadai, tetapi sikat cat atau kuas untuk kue yang berminyak juga harus menjadi perhatian bagi kita sebagai Muslim.Contoh nyata adalah kasus kuas merek Eterna yang telah diuji oleh LPPOM dan hasilnya positif menggunakan bulu babi.Selain melihat kemasannya, ada cara lain untuk mengetahuinya, yaitu dengan membakarnya.Jika kuas atau kuas berbau tidak enak, kemungkinan besar menggunakan bulu babi.Menurut Imam Syafii, kuas yang terbuat dari bulu babi yang digunakan untuk melukis masjid akan membuat masjid ditutupi dengan kenajisan dan harus segera dihapus.Selain itu, jika landak laut menjadi sikat gigi yang kami gunakan setiap hari.Oleh karena itu, hati -hati dan terus waspada terhadap berbagai produk yang dapat membahayakan kita sebagai Muslim.

berita: On social networks, there is a lot of information circulating that calls catfish the filthiest fish. In a mouthful of catfish meat, there are 3,000 cancer cells. The nickname as the filthiest fish refers to the nature of catfish who are fond of consuming all kinds of waste in the waters. Even an article that is quite viral on the internet mentions that human waste is also used as feed for a catfish cultivation in Haikou City, China. This fish is equipped with an additional breathing apparatus in the form of a labyrinth, so that it can survive in muddy or even polluted water conditions. Presumably, this is what raises the suspicion about the accumulation of carcinogenic toxins (cancer causing) in the body of catfish. Investigation: The catfish circulating in the market do not come from the wild. Many catfish are cultivated in ponds, which should be controlled so that they are free from pollution. The feed given can also be chosen, not having to rely on waste. The number of catfish production also continues to increase every year. Data from the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) shows that catfish production in 2013 reached 543,461 tons, an increase from 441,217 tons in 2012 and 337,577 tons in 2011. According to the Central Statistics Agency (BPS), catfish consumption was 29.98 kg/capita/year, up from 22.58 kg/capita/year in 2004. In Jakarta, no less than 6,000 pecel catfish stalls have been registered with the trunk Indonesian Street Vendors Association (APKLI). Regarding the nutritional content, it is undeniable that catfish is a cheap source of valuable protein. The fact that catfish is also low in cholesterol is likely to drown out accusations that catfish can cause cancer. Dr. Dradjat R Suardi, SpB(K)Onk, a cancer expert from the Indonesian Oncology Association, said that until now there has been no research that says eating catfish can trigger cancer.
berita_id: Di jejaring sosial, ada banyak informasi yang beredar yang menyebut ikan Catfish sebagai ikan paling kotor.Dalam seteguk daging lele, ada 3.000 sel kanker.Julukan sebagai ikan paling kotor mengacu pada sifat ikan lele yang suka mengonsumsi semua jenis limbah di perairan.Bahkan sebuah artikel yang cukup viral di internet menyebutkan bahwa limbah manusia juga digunakan sebagai pakan untuk budidaya ikan lele di Kota Haikou, Cina.Ikan ini dilengkapi dengan peralatan pernapasan tambahan dalam bentuk labirin, sehingga dapat bertahan hidup dalam kondisi air berlumpur atau bahkan tercemar.Agaknya, inilah yang menimbulkan kecurigaan tentang akumulasi racun karsinogenik (penyebab kanker) dalam tubuh ikan lele.Investigasi: Lele yang beredar di pasar tidak datang dari alam liar.Banyak ikan lele yang dibudidayakan di kolam, yang harus dikendalikan sehingga mereka bebas dari polusi.Pakan yang diberikan juga dapat dipilih, tidak harus mengandalkan limbah.Jumlah produksi ikan lele juga terus meningkat setiap tahun.Data from the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) shows that catfish production in 2013 reached 543,461 tons, an increase from 441,217 tons in 2012 and 337,577 tons in 2011. According to the Central Statistics Agency (BPS), catfish consumption was 29.98 kg/capita/year, up from 22.58 kg/capita/year in 2004. InJakarta, tidak kurang dari 6.000 kios ikan lele Pecel telah terdaftar di Asosiasi Pejabat Jalanan Indonesia (APKLI).Mengenai kandungan nutrisi, tidak dapat dipungkiri bahwa ikan lele adalah sumber protein berharga yang murah.Fakta bahwa ikan lele juga rendah kolesterol cenderung menenggelamkan tuduhan bahwa ikan lele dapat menyebabkan kanker.Dradjat R Suardi, SPB (K) Onk, seorang ahli kanker dari Asosiasi Onkologi Indonesia, mengatakan bahwa sampai sekarang belum ada penelitian yang mengatakan makan ikan lele dapat memicu kanker.

berita: News about Pokemon being a Jewish product became a trending topic on the Muslim Journal's Fanpage. Four posts titled Pokemon topped the list as the most read posts in mid-July. Here are some titles of articles that have had many viewers in the last few days on the Muslim Journal website as of 19/7/16: 1. Meaning of Pokemon in Syriac: "I'm Jewish," with 152,269 views by blogger. (Read the article here) clause 2. Did you know? Pokemon Products Are Jewish Missions, Contains Defamatory Elements of Islam with views reaching 110,028 by blogger. (Read the article here) 3. Game 'Pokemon Go' fever is spreading, this is the positive and negative impact, with viewers reaching 85,707 by blogger. (Read the article here) 4. Meaning of Pikachu in Syriac: "Be a Jew," with 76,887 views by blogger. (Read the article here) The popularity of the above articles has become the subject of discussion by many netizens, especially social media users such as Facebook, Twitter, etc. The reason is, the article that talks about the relationship between Jews and Pokemon reaps the pros and cons. A few hours ago there were several electronic letters that entered the Muslim Journal contact, either via Facebook or Email, as we have provided contact information on the Jurnalmuslim.com website. Some of them asked the validity of the articles mentioned above. There were even some who stated that the article was a hoax and the Muslim Journal website was accused of spreading slander. The link between Judaism and Pokemon Movies is an old 'issue' Our team of journalists, Nisyi, is motivated to raise the issue of the relationship between Pokemon and Jews because of the recent boom in Niantic's game product, Pokemon Go. When we clarified his motivation and reason for writing the article, he replied that it was an old issue that was brought up again. The issue of a link between Jews and Pokemon has existed since the Pokemon movie was broadcast on private televisions, namely in 2001 and was first broadcast by SCTV (Read about Pokemon for the first time airing on private television: wikipedia). "There were many leaflets about the relationship between Pokemon and Jews that were distributed in several cities when the Pokemon Movie was shown on the screen. Not only Pokemon, but several children's TV series were also included in the content of the leaflets. All of which talked about the existence of Jewish elements in children's cartoon series at the time." Nishi said. Muslim Journalists never post articles/news unless they include the source Because the data from the opinion of the relationship between Jews and Pokemon is no longer available. Our journalist, nisyi, tries to retrieve the data through the Internet. And indeed, a lot of writings that talk about the topic of Jews and Pokemon. Here are some articles that discuss the relationship between Jews and Pokemon: Article about Pokemon and Jews by Reika on her blog, posted in 2013 Article about Pokemon and Jews by smzblog on his blog, posted in 2008 Article about Pokemon and Jews by Dudung on his website, posted in 2011 It can be seen that the issue between Jews and Pokemon existed in the years before the Pokemon Go game was released. From here, our journalists take their opinion from an article sourced from the neutralitas.com site. For those who want to know about the neteritas.com website profile, please read here. In full, sources of opinion writing about Pokemon and Jews can be found here. The pros and cons of the issue of the connection between Jews and Pokemon is also an old issue In the article about Judaism and Pokemon, there are sensitive matters concerning Religion, especially Islam. That is about the meaning of Pokemon and some names of monsters in the Pokemon TV series. For example, it is stated that the Syriac meaning of Pokemon is "I am Jewish." Unfortunately, that statement is an opinion, and there are many pros and cons of that meaning. Among those who dispute this statement is an article quoted by a web developer who is also a Division of Information Technology at Bank BTPN Head Office, Dudung, on his website dudung.net, taken from the source ia-wutsqo. It was stated that leaflets about the relationship between Jews and Pokemon as well as several children's cartoons were not only spread in Indonesia, but also in Saudi, Jordan, Egypt and several other Middle Eastern regions. However, it was also mentioned that after being confirmed by a number of linguists, they generally rejected the notion that the word Pokemon and some of the monsters in Pokemon had a relationship with the Syriac language. Which means that the assumptions contained in the leaflet itself are not necessarily true. Reporting from solo.tribunnews (18/7/16), the LA Times news noted that Nintendo refuted the perception of the connection between Pokemon and Judaism. It is said that Pokemon is actually just an abbreviation of Pocket Monster or pocket monster. Named Pocket Monster because this pokemon has a pocket ball that can be put in a pocket. (Read here) What is interesting here is that it was informed on the dudung.net and tribune sites that Pokemon shows in several countries, such as Jordan, had attracted the attention of residents and even the local government. Quoted by Dudung, that a number of youths and children in Jordan have carried out mass arson actions against goods containing images of Pokemon. The problem is not only related to the meanings that are not necessarily true, but the Pokemon game has had quite a negative impact on children. The full article can be read here (posted in 2001). Regardless of the pros and cons of that perception, in this post, the editor of the Muslim Journal will clarify an article about the relationship between Pokemon and Jews by our journalist, Nisyi, a few days ago. That the article is the opinion of several writings in several media, be it leaflets, or other electronic media. Each of these articles has been given a clear source, and is not just a made-up opinion without any reference review. In this post, we as the editors thank you for the suggestions, input, and constructive criticism submitted through our contact information on the Jurnalmuslim.com site. We will definitely respond to suggestions, input and constructive criticism and are always used as material for evaluation for the Muslim Journal site. May Allah open the hearts of His servants to be able to receive guidance. Al Haq min rabbika falaa takunanna minal mumtarin, the truth is from your Lord Allah and do not be of those who doubt.

Warganet is still confused about the unclear information regarding the fate of Facebook in Indonesia. There are even those who are desperate to do nude actions so that Facebook is not closed. Understandably, the article is that Facebook users in Indonesia have reached 140 million, and this platform has become a place for sharing among many people. Don't worry, because the Minister of Communication and Information (Menkominfo) Rudiantara will not block (close) Facebook permanently, but only temporarily. That is if the situation gets worse. "We will see this situation first. If it gets worse, then we will temporarily close (block it)," said Minister of Communication and Information Rudiantara. Rudiantara is reluctant to talk about closing Facebook operations permanently, he is more focused on monitoring Facebook to create data security and prevent the spread of hate speech. The House of Representatives also had asked Kominfo to be more strict with Facebook. "We and the government - the Ministry of Communication and Information - will talk again regarding the follow-up to Facebook's mistake. Personally, I am still open to sanctions, it data point is also possible to - suggest - a Facebook service moratorium," said Meutya Hafid, a member of the Commission. I DPR RI. Meutya estimates that the DPR RI will wait for the results of Facebook's internal investigation for the next month. "We are waiting, I think a month should be enough time. We hope that the results of this investigation will not only blame who, but also there must be information, where this misused data is and what it is used for," he said. Case Beginning The controversy arose from the Cambridge Analytica scandal, which accused Facebook of leaking data. After being investigated, it turns out that "leaking" is not the right term. The data was not leaked, but rather misused by Cambridge Analytica, allegedly for political purposes. The data taken is also not the content of the message, but data that is publicly listed on a person's profile. Unfortunately, the rice has become porridge. There has been confusion about this, to the point that the DPR also summoned Facebook to ask for an explanation. As a result, the discourse of blocking Facebook arises. "That Facebook data is not leaked. If it leaks, the term is like a pipe with water, you don't know where the leak is, this data is compromised," said Rudiantara. Facebook has been given SP 2 The Ministry of Communication and Information has sent SP 2 to Facebook, but there is no information about SP 3 which means closing. When asked about the validity period of SP 2 to the next SP, Rudiantara has not yet given a definitive answer. "Yes, it could be a day, a month, see the situation first," concluded Rudiantara. He claimed to have received an explanation from the Irish Facebook office which manages Facebook in Indonesia. In a statement by Facebook Ireland to Rudiantara, they provided information on numbers related to misuse of data that afflicted users. Rudiantara also continues to monitor the development of Indonesian user data on Facebook.
berita_id: Warganet masih bingung tentang informasi yang tidak jelas mengenai nasib Facebook di Indonesia.Bahkan ada orang -orang yang sangat ingin melakukan tindakan telanjang sehingga Facebook tidak ditutup.Maklum, artikelnya adalah bahwa pengguna Facebook di Indonesia telah mencapai 140 juta, dan platform ini telah menjadi tempat untuk berbagi di antara banyak orang.Jangan khawatir, karena Menteri Komunikasi dan Informasi (Menkominfo) Rudiantara tidak akan memblokir (menutup) Facebook secara permanen, tetapi hanya sementara.Itu jika situasinya semakin buruk."Kami akan melihat situasi ini terlebih dahulu. Jika menjadi lebih buruk, maka kami akan untuk sementara waktu akan menutup (memblokirnya)," kata Menteri Komunikasi dan Informasi Rudiantara.Rudiantara enggan berbicara tentang menutup operasi Facebook secara permanen, ia lebih fokus pada pemantauan Facebook untuk menciptakan keamanan data dan mencegah penyebaran pidato kebencian.Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat juga telah meminta Kominfo untuk lebih ketat dengan Facebook."Kami dan pemerintah - Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informasi - akan berbicara lagi mengenai tindak lanjut dari kesalahan Facebook. Secara pribadi, saya masih terbuka untuk sanksi, titik data itu juga dimungkinkan untuk - menyarankan - moratorium layanan Facebook," kata Meutya Hafid, anggota komisi.I DPR RI.Meutya memperkirakan bahwa DPR RI akan menunggu hasil penyelidikan internal Facebook untuk bulan berikutnya."Kami sedang menunggu, saya pikir sebulan harus menjadi cukup waktu. Kami berharap hasil penyelidikan ini tidak hanya akan menyalahkan siapa, tetapi juga harus ada informasi, di mana data yang disalahgunakan ini dan untuk apa itu digunakan," katanya.Kasus yang memulai kontroversi muncul dari skandal Cambridge Analytica, yang menuduh Facebook bocor data.Setelah diselidiki, ternyata "bocor" bukanlah istilah yang tepat.Data itu tidak bocor, melainkan disalahgunakan oleh Cambridge Analytica, yang diduga untuk tujuan politik.Data yang diambil juga bukan konten pesan, tetapi data yang terdaftar di depan umum pada profil seseorang.Sayangnya, nasi telah menjadi bubur.Telah ada kebingungan tentang hal ini, sampai -sampai DPR juga memanggil Facebook untuk meminta penjelasan.Akibatnya, wacana memblokir Facebook muncul."Data Facebook itu tidak bocor. Jika bocor, istilahnya seperti pipa dengan air, Anda tidak tahu di mana bocornya, data ini dikompromikan," kata Rudiantara.Facebook telah diberikan SP 2 Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informasi telah mengirim SP 2 ke Facebook, tetapi tidak ada informasi tentang SP 3 yang berarti penutupan.Ketika ditanya tentang periode validitas SP 2 ke SP berikutnya, Rudiantara belum memberikan jawaban yang pasti."Ya, itu bisa jadi sehari, sebulan, melihat situasinya terlebih dahulu," pungkas Rudiantara.Dia mengaku telah menerima penjelasan dari kantor Facebook Irlandia yang mengelola Facebook di Indonesia.Dalam sebuah pernyataan oleh Facebook Irlandia ke Rudiantara, mereka memberikan informasi tentang angka -angka yang terkait dengan penyalahgunaan data yang pengguna yang menderita.Rudiantara juga terus memantau pengembangan data pengguna Indonesia di Facebook.

berita: Buleleng Police Narcotics Unit officers together with the Buleleng Industry and Trade Office conducted raids on several candy traders in schools in the Singaraja city area, on Thursday (9/3) morning. This raid was based on the rising circulation of issues on social media stating that candy shaped like a baby pacifier, containing drugs is currently ab initio circulating throughout Indonesia. The allegation of the pacifier containing drugs initially occurred in Central Java. This information suddenly made the Buleleng Police officer furious. To prove the reality, they also conducted raids while socializing in several locations such as SDN 3 and 4 Banjar Jawa, SDN 1 Banjar Tegal, SDN 1, 2, and 5 Banyuasri. The Head of Narcotics at the Buleleng Police, AKP I Ketut Adnyana, said that until now, candy pacifiers in Buleleng had not been found. However, it still asks all students, school teachers and the community to remain vigilant. “If anyone sees a candy pacifier that says hard candy, please let us know immediately. This is because the dot-shaped candy contains a drug substance, which if consumed will cause addiction. If it is found, we will immediately take it for a lab check,” he explained in front of all the students of SDN 3 and 4 Banjar Jawa, Singaraja. From field observations, until 10.32 WITA, alert notices had been posted in school canteens by officers from the Buleleng Police Narcotics Unit and the Buleleng Industry and Trade Office.
berita_id: Petugas Unit Narkotika Polisi Buleleng bersama -sama dengan industri Buleleng dan kantor perdagangan melakukan penggerebekan pada beberapa pedagang permen di sekolah -sekolah di daerah Kota Singaraja, pada hari Kamis (9/3) pagi.Penggerebekan ini didasarkan pada meningkatnya sirkulasi masalah di media sosial yang menyatakan bahwa permen berbentuk seperti dot bayi, yang mengandung obat -obatan saat ini beredar di seluruh Indonesia.Tuduhan dot yang mengandung obat -obatan awalnya terjadi di Jawa Tengah.Informasi ini tiba -tiba membuat petugas polisi Buleleng marah.Untuk membuktikan kenyataan, mereka juga melakukan penggerebekan sambil bersosialisasi di beberapa lokasi seperti SDN 3 dan 4 Banjar Jawa, Sdn 1 Banjar Tegal, Sdn 1, 2, dan 5 Banyuasri.Kepala narkotika di Polisi Buleleng, AKP I Ketut Adnyana, mengatakan bahwa sampai sekarang, dot permen di Buleleng belum ditemukan.Namun, masih meminta semua siswa, guru sekolah dan masyarakat untuk tetap waspada."Jika ada yang melihat dot permen yang mengatakan permen keras, tolong beri tahu kami segera. Ini karena permen berbentuk titik berisi zat obat, yang jika dikonsumsi akan menyebabkan kecanduan. Jika ditemukan, kami akan segera menerimanya untuk pemeriksaan lab," jelasnya di depan semua siswa SDN 3 dan 4 Banjar Jawa, Singaraja.Dari pengamatan lapangan, hingga 10.32 Wita, pemberitahuan peringatan telah diposting di kantin sekolah oleh petugas dari Unit Narkotika Polisi Buleleng dan industri dan kantor perdagangan Buleleng.

berita: The news of the dot candy which is indicated to contain drugs in Surabaya was immediately anticipated by the Banyuwangi City Police. Preventive measures are carried out by conducting raids on snacks at SDN Brawijaya. As a result, 4 cartons of Penguine Brand hard candy were found in one of the vendors' stalls. The powdered candy which was packaged in a bottle in the shape of a baby pacifier was immediately secured to the Banyuwangi Police Headquarters. Each carton contains 20 candy pacifiers. The total number of sweets brought by constabulary the officers was about 80 pieces. According to the Head of the Banyuwangi City Police, AKP Ali Masduki, his party is investigating this light snack with the Banyuwangi Police Satnarkoba to ascertain whether it contains drugs. "We are trying to do a laboratory test by involving a team from the Narcotics Unit. If the candy is positive for containing drugs, the legal process will proceed to the investigation stage. Otherwise, we will definitely return all the goods to their owners," explained Pama, who once held the position of KBO Satreskrim Banyuwangi Police. In addition to securing the pacifiers, the Banyuwangi Police also summoned Widiyanto (32), a wholesaler of pacifiers. The trader who claims to live in the Villa Bukit Mas Housing Village/Giri Sub-district was asked for information regarding the goods he traded. "Candies are sent from Surabaya via packages," explained AKP. Ali Masduki. Anticipatory steps taken by this apparatus are to prevent victims from falling among students who consume sweets imported from China. Prior to the raid, his party had conducted socialization to a number of elementary schools in the Banyuwangi District area. “Our raid was held following the news in the mass media and social media that was getting more intense. It turned out that in the Banyuwangi City area, traders were found selling such goods. Finally, we secure it for investigation to determine whether the pacifier-shaped candy contains drugs or not. Don't let people get restless without certainty," he said. The news of the Penguine Brand candy containing drugs shocked Widiyanto. During the 10 years of trading hard candy, this is the first time he has dealt with the police. Ironically, this case sticks out at a time when the candy pacifier is still in the market. “Now the market is sluggish. Goods sent from Surabaya every 2 weeks do not run out quickly. Some of the bottles are sold for Rp. 1000. But sometimes there are those who sell them for Rp. 2000 per bottle. Each carton contains 20 seeds,” said this trader from Kampung Melayu, Banyuwangi.
berita_id: Berita permen DOT yang diindikasikan mengandung obat -obatan di Surabaya segera diantisipasi oleh polisi Kota Banyuwangi.Langkah -langkah pencegahan dilakukan dengan melakukan penggerebekan pada makanan ringan di SDN Brawijaya.Akibatnya, 4 karton permen Hard Brand Hard Candy ditemukan di salah satu kios vendor.Permen bubuk yang dikemas dalam botol dalam bentuk dot bayi segera diamankan ke markas polisi Banyuwangi.Setiap karton berisi 20 dot permen.Jumlah total permen yang dibawa oleh Constabulary, para petugas sekitar 80 buah.Menurut kepala polisi Kota Banyuwangi, AKP Ali Masduki, partainya sedang menyelidiki camilan ringan ini dengan polisi Banyuwangi Satnarkoba untuk memastikan apakah itu berisi obat -obatan."Kami mencoba melakukan tes laboratorium dengan melibatkan tim dari unit narkotika. Jika permen positif untuk berisi obat -obatan, proses hukum akan melanjutkan ke tahap investigasi. Kalau tidak, kami pasti akan mengembalikan semua barang kepada pemiliknya," jelas Pama, yang pernah memegang posisi Kepolisian KBO Satreskrim BanyUwangi.Selain mengamankan dot, polisi Banyuwangi juga memanggil Widiyanto (32), pedagang dot.Pedagang yang mengklaim tinggal di Villa Bukit Mas Housing Village/Sub-District Giri diminta informasi mengenai barang-barang yang ia perdagangkan."Permen dikirim dari Surabaya melalui paket," jelas AKP.Ali Masduki.Langkah -langkah antisipatif yang diambil oleh peralatan ini adalah untuk mencegah korban jatuh di antara siswa yang mengonsumsi permen yang diimpor dari Cina.Sebelum serangan itu, partainya telah melakukan sosialisasi ke sejumlah sekolah dasar di wilayah distrik Banyuwangi."Penggerebekan kami diadakan mengikuti berita di media massa dan media sosial yang semakin kuat. Ternyata di daerah Kota Banyuwangi, para pedagang ditemukan menjual barang-barang tersebut. Akhirnya, kami mengamankannya untuk penyelidikan untuk menentukan apakah permen berbentuk dot berisi obat-obatan atau tidak. Jangan biarkan orang menjadi gelisah tanpa kepastian," katanya.Berita tentang merek penguin yang mengandung obat -obatan terkejut dengan melelahkan.Selama 10 tahun perdagangan permen keras, ini adalah pertama kalinya ia berurusan dengan polisi.Ironisnya, kasus ini menonjol pada saat dot permen masih ada di pasar."Sekarang pasar lamban. Barang yang dikirim dari Surabaya setiap 2 minggu tidak habis dengan cepat. Beberapa botol dijual seharga Rp. 1000. Tapi kadang -kadang ada orang -orang yang menjualnya seharga Rp. 2000 per botol. Setiap karton berisi 20 biji," kata pedagang ini dari Kampung Melayu, BanyUwangi.

berita: A number of members of the Ponorogo Reog Community (KRP) visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs office to ask for clarification regarding the burning of reog in front of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines. 15 KRP representatives gathered in front of the office of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Kemlu). They brought reog, a banner that reads decisive action against burning reyog at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines and an open letter to the Minister of Foreign Affairs Retno Marsudi. Their arrival was related to the burning of reog that occurred at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao on 20 October. They also attached a picture showing the burning of the reog. We will not do any action or demo. "We just want to ask for information and clarification from the Minister and firm action against the government regarding this incident," Deputy Chairman of the KRP S Nojeng told reporters. After waiting for some time, 5 KRP representatives were received by the Director of Development of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs at 10.20 WIB. For 30 minutes they held a meeting and as a result the Ministry of Foreign Affairs promised to seek information related to the incident and notify KRP again. A protest banner to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs will later be clarified there why there could be an incident like this and will be notified again, said Nojeng who participated in the meeting. Meanwhile, in a press release from the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao which was published on its website, it was explained that on October 20, 2015 the Consulate General in Davao City was forced to destroy the Ponorogo reog which had been an asset of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City since 1988. The destruction by burning had to be carried out because the Ponorogo reog was already in a state of disrepair. damaged and eaten by termites. The burning was in no way an ministry attempt by the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City to damage or eliminate Reog Ponorogo as a cultural asset. The destruction of these assets has been carried out carefully and with full respect for Reog Ponorogo as a cultural asset. The Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City also wants to emphasize that the burning has absolutely nothing to do with efforts to expel idols or spirits, he wrote. The Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City is currently communicating with parties in Indonesia to seek a new replacement for Reog Ponorogo, he continued.
berita_id: Sejumlah anggota Komunitas Reog Ponorogo (KRP) mengunjungi Kantor Kementerian Luar Negeri untuk meminta klarifikasi mengenai pembakaran reog di depan konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao, Filipina.15 Perwakilan KRP berkumpul di depan Kantor Kementerian Luar Negeri (Kemlu).Mereka membawa Reog, sebuah spanduk yang membaca tindakan tegas terhadap pembakaran Reyog di Jenderal Konsulat Indonesia di Davao, Filipina dan surat terbuka kepada Menteri Luar Negeri Retno Marsudi.Kedatangan mereka terkait dengan pembakaran reog yang terjadi di Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao pada 20 Oktober.Mereka juga memasang gambar yang menunjukkan pembakaran reog.Kami tidak akan melakukan tindakan atau demo apa pun."Kami hanya ingin meminta informasi dan klarifikasi dari menteri dan tindakan tegas terhadap pemerintah mengenai insiden ini," kata wakil ketua KRP S Nojeng kepada wartawan.Setelah menunggu beberapa waktu, 5 perwakilan KRP diterima oleh Direktur Pengembangan Kementerian Luar Negeri di 10.20 WIB.Selama 30 menit mereka mengadakan pertemuan dan sebagai hasilnya, Kementerian Luar Negeri berjanji untuk mencari informasi yang terkait dengan insiden tersebut dan memberi tahu KRP lagi.Sebuah spanduk protes untuk Kementerian Luar Negeri kemudian akan diklarifikasi di sana mengapa mungkin ada insiden seperti ini dan akan diberitahu lagi, kata Nojeng yang berpartisipasi dalam pertemuan tersebut.Sementara itu, dalam siaran pers dari Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Davao yang diterbitkan di situs webnya, dijelaskan bahwa pada 20 Oktober 2015 Konsulat Jenderal di Kota Davao dipaksa untuk menghancurkan Ponorogo Reog yang telah menjadi aset yang sudah ada di Konsulat di Kota Davao sejak 1988. Kekurangannya oleh pembakaran yang sudah ada di dalam Konsulat di Davao sejak 1988. Kekurangan oleh pembakaran yang sudah ada di dalam Konsulat di Davao sejak 1988. Kekurangan oleh pembakaran yang sudah ada di dalam Konsulat di Davao sejak tahun 1988. Kekurangan oleh pembakaran yang akan menjadi cengkerog di Indonesian di Davao sejak 1988. Kekurangan oleh pembakaran yang akan menjadi cengkeru.rusak dan dimakan rayap.Pembakaran itu sama sekali bukan upaya kementerian oleh konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Kota Davao untuk merusak atau menghilangkan reog Ponorogo sebagai aset budaya.Penghancuran aset -aset ini telah dilakukan dengan hati -hati dan dengan penuh rasa hormat terhadap Reog Ponorogo sebagai aset budaya.Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Kota Davao juga ingin menekankan bahwa pembakaran sama sekali tidak ada hubungannya dengan upaya untuk mengeluarkan berhala atau roh, tulisnya.Konsulat Jenderal Indonesia di Kota Davao saat ini sedang berkomunikasi dengan partai -partai di Indonesia untuk mencari pengganti baru untuk Reog Ponorogo, lanjutnya.

berita: Related in Oral B brand toothbrush made of Bristles. From the results put out of a google search, Bristles means sea urchins, the Head of the North Sumatra Health Service, Usma Polita, said that he would seek the truth about the toothbrush which was suspected to contain sea urchins. "Now I want to see the truth of this, because it really needs to be investigated whether it contains sea urchins or not. If proven, there must be MUI readiness to declare halal or not halal, we will work if there is such a statement," said Mangkara Street, Tuesday (8/3/2016). Meanwhile, the Chairman of the Medan City MUI, Muhammad Hatta said, if it is true that the toothbrush is made of pig bristles, the toothbrush is haram. "In Al Surah Al Maidah verse 3 it is explained that derivatives from pigs are haram. We will explore this prohibition, really from sea urchins or not," he said via cellular. He added, if proven, MUI will publish to the public so they don't use the toothbrush. In addition, MUI will withdraw the product from the market.
berita_id: Terkait dalam sikat gigi oral B yang terbuat dari bulu.Dari hasil yang dikeluarkan dari pencarian Google, bulu berarti bulu babi, kepala Layanan Kesehatan Sumatra Utara, USMA Polita, mengatakan bahwa ia akan mencari kebenaran tentang sikat gigi yang diduga mengandung landak laut."Sekarang saya ingin melihat kebenaran dari ini, karena itu benar -benar perlu diselidiki apakah itu mengandung bulu babi atau tidak. Jika terbukti, harus ada kesiapan MUI untuk menyatakan halal atau tidak halal, kami akan bekerja jika ada pernyataan seperti itu," kata Mangkara Street, Selasa (8/3/2016).Sementara itu, ketua Medan City MUI, Muhammad Hatta berkata, jika benar bahwa sikat gigi terbuat dari bulu babi, sikat gigi adalah haram."Dalam Al Surah Al Maidah, ayat 3 dijelaskan bahwa turunan dari babi adalah Haram. Kami akan mengeksplorasi larangan ini, benar -benar dari bulu babi atau tidak," katanya melalui seluler.Dia menambahkan, jika terbukti, MUI akan menerbitkan kepada publik sehingga mereka tidak menggunakan sikat gigi.Selain itu, MUI akan menarik produk dari pasar.

berita: A number of members of the Ponorogo Reyog Community (KRP) visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Kemlu) office to ask for information and clarification regarding the burning of reyog at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, Philippines. The Indonesian Consulate General in Davao himself said that the burned reyog had been damaged and eaten by termites. 18 KRP representatives gathered in front of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Kemlu) office, Jl Pejambon, Central Jakarta, Monday (2/10/2015). They brought 2 sudden peacocks, a barong, and a gayor with a picture of a dragon, a banner that reads "Resolute Action on Burning Reyog at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao Philippines" and an open letter to Foreign Minister Retno LP Marsudi. Their arrival was related to the burning of reog that occurred at the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao on 20 October. They also attached a picture showing the reyog burning. "Our visit is to officially ask the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, which is the "superior" of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao - Philippines to convey information and clarification honestly and transparently regarding the burning of Reyog Ponorogo's property," said KRP Chairman, Suyatno to Suarajakarta.co, Monday (2/11). ). Suyatno was accompanied, among others, by the Deputy Chairperson of the KRP Suparno Nojeng, the Secretary of the KRP M Syaiful Jihad, the Treasurer of the KRP Agus Susanto, the leader of the reyog group Singo Wiro Yudho, Eko Prasetyo and the reyog artist who had performed in Davao Philippines in 2005, Suyono Gendon. After waiting for some time, 6 KRP representatives were received by Siti Sofia Sudarma, Director of Information and Media at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs at 10.20 squad WIB. For 30 minutes they held a meeting and as a result the Ministry of Foreign Affairs promised to seek information related to the incident by forming a team to the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao in the near future. "The team will further clarify the incident and we will convey the results to the KRP," said Sofia. Explanation of the Consulate General in Davao Meanwhile, in a press release from the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao which was published on its website, it was explained that on October 20, 2015 the Consulate General in Davao City was forced to destroy the Ponorogo reog which had been an asset of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao City since 1988.
